description:
Came in on a Sunday night, around 7:30pm? At the time it was fairly quiet but more people seemed to come in as we ate. Its a pretty chill bar with good bar food. 

The burger is delicious! The meat patty is thick and juicy and cooked to perfection! The garlic aioli is also really good and all the flavours together just make it a really solid burger. The potato bits add a great crunch. Would order again.

The southern fried chicken sando is interesting. The flavours I get from it don't scream southern to me but like a sweet chili sauce with like a thai flavour. Its nkt bad but would try something else next time.
author: Chung H.

description:
I came on a weekday starving after an extremely late night at work and can I just say this place is absolutely fantastic! The burger was absolutely delicious and the fries were perfect. There were a lot of other things on the menu that sounded super good too that I would I loved to try. The loaded fries sound amazing!! I would definitely recommend this place if you are looking for a great, late night meal.

I was really here to eat dinner so the music was too loud for me (I am becoming an old fart.) However, I can see that it would be a fun bar for people who are looking for good drinks and food. Can't wait to try other stuff since I am sure there will be other opportunities to work late... hahaha.
author: Jocelyn K.

description:
I was really hurt by the manager tonight. He accused me of being inebriated because I was not walking stable, and my entire group was asked to leave altogether before we could order anything. We had actually walked 6 blocks to get here for a late night warm meal. I was the only one in high heels. Understandably, my feet were blistered due to the friction in this condition and had caused difficulty in my stride. I had offered to show him my blisters in hopes of staying for a meal but he mercilessly refused. I felt extremely guilty that my friends could not have a meal after the long walk there and we were all freezing and starving.

I don't believe customers should be falsely accused, misdiagnosed and discriminated against for not being able to walk comfortably. He was did not show compassion nor kindness to us. It was incredibly rude, disrespectful and hurtful. We will not be returning.
author: Maria H.

description:
Small dive bar tucked away on a small street but it was still packed with after work folk. They have a list of beer and shot combinations which we took full advantage of! We also ordered sweet potato fries and fully loaded fries. All were very tasty and the sweet potato fries were probably the best I've had. They added cinnamon or something that made it have a distinctive flavor. 
I wouldn't mind coming here again for some after work drinks and for HH.
author: Jenna T.

description:
Amazing food but lackluster service. Sister bar and restaraunt Tempest in soma is one of my favorite spots and they serve alot of the same menu. Iv been interested in trying the place since its near my work, alot more convinient to get to, and supposedly an old historic whaling bar.

The food is amazing same as tempest/box kitchen. I had the quail egg and crispy pork belly potato skins and the corned beef Reuben egg rolls both of which were excellent. I got like 50 bucks of drinks as well. A shot of fernet, a top billin cocktail, and a variety of craft beers. The drinks were solid and made me drunk.  

I sat at the bar and both bartenders here were dicks tho. Shortly after I sat down 2 businessmen sat next to me and within a few minutes of chatting and browsing the menu they were told to order or get out that seats are rented and this isnt Starbucks. In several hours they made zero conversation and just complained about the customers to each other. I asked one of them for a cocktail recommendation and he looked at me like something was wrong with me said shot of whiskey and left. No joke with a follow up just an autist with zero people skills in a customer service job. The bouncer and assistant who was occasionally at the bar were cool tho for what its worth. 

If you want the same dank food with good service go to tempest instead. Not even anything historical or whaling related here. Not saying im a hardcore history buff but an oldschool moby dick vibe as advertised would have been cool instead of a generic alleyway dive.
author: Sean G.

description:
An amazing bar with even better food. My friends and I come here frequently after a night out solely for the awesome food, but their drinks are tasty as well. 

Our go-to's are the pork belly potato skins and the loaded fries. A drunk person's dream. Sooooo gooooood. See you soon!
author: Jamie J.

description:
What can I say about Louie's that hasn't been said by others? Probably not much, because this place is fantastic!! 

Let's start with the obvious: it's a bar...no it's a great bar...better yet, it's an amazing bar! They have a fantastic beer selection that is always updating.

A bit less obvious, but something you definitely need to pay attention to: the food!! As much as I love trying new things (and I do) I'm always a sucker for their Rueben egg roles! Holy hell, if you're a Reuben fan, a fan of meat in fried wrapper or someone with some semblance of a decent palate, then you need to get on this!! 

Then there's the burger! Let me preface this by saying I'm not a burger guy. If I go somewhere and see practically anything else on the menu that mildly peeks my interest, I'll pick that over a burger. Louis' is a whole different beast! This thing is out of this world!!! The description alone had me: Schmitz Ranch beef, bacon bourbon bbq jam, potato sticks, aioli and arugula on a potato pepper bun. Yes please! They cooked it perfectly; it was juicy and flavorful and everything and more that I wanted it to be. The fries were fine...nothing special, but solid fries. But who cares - I only had eyes for that burger!
author: Vincent B.

description:
Oh man the Southern Fried Chicken Sando was gooooood.

I was walking towards "The Bird" on a sunday and realized after reaching the place is closed. So i looked around for a place and found Louie's Bar. I wasnt expecting much out of the place but once we got there the place seemed nice for drinks and food.

The southern fried chicken sando was super delicious and the drinks were great too. Try it out if you are around the financial district and you wont regret it.
author: Urvish -.

description: I ate lunch here about half a dozen times when I was consulting down the street last year.   I sampled a variety of sandwiches but my favorite is by far the Grilled Cheese Sando Yo.   As far as appetizers are concerned, the Deviled Eggs were delicious.   I'd typically wash it all down with a nice draft beer.  No complaints!
author: David O.

description:
Arrived into SFO late Thursday night last week.  Checked into my hotel only to find out that the bar and restaurant was closed.  Coming from Vegas, I forget that everywhere is NOT 24 hours.  haha  

The drinks were great, the service was great, and I ordered The Burger and fries....EXCELLENT!  What a great place with great atmosphere.
author: Jason T.

description:
Lunchtime review. 

I was excited to try Louie's for lunch the other day because I'm aware it's owned by the same people as Tempest (which I LOVE) but, my meal was pretty meh. Maybe it was my order (avocado salad) but, it was just alright...especially for the price. I suppose I know better then to expect a great salad at a place like Louie's because it's focus is more on "bar" food but, I wanted a healthy option that day. 

Anyway, the service was great and everyone was super friendly despite the long lunchtime wait. Not their fault. In fact, they took our drink orders while we were waiting which was smart. Smart. 

Don't let this review discourage your visit because I'm sure there are much better lunch options. I'll be back to give this place another chance and try some of the heartier options.
author: Benjamin F.

description: Love this this place after work or on a Friday night. Everyone is very cool, options for food or drinks are good.
author: Scot M.

description: This spot will always have a place in my heart. Bomb ass drink selection: beers, spirits you name it... they also have a bunch of cool combo deals. My favorite is the hell or high watermelon beer with a shot of mezcal. Lol so good! Also the pork belly potato skins are something I praise!
author: Anjoleen S.

description:
Great pub a little hidden away from the busy streets of SF! When you walk towards this place you'll know you found it when you see the twinkle lights outside. It's a cool location that makes do with the space it has and has a nice change of ambiance. 

They have the tables mainly located in the back of the place and standing room near the entrance. I warn you that it does get packed so it's good to come here early if you want to nab some tables for your group. It does get loud here too so you might find yourself close and personal while you have your conversation, but that is part of the experience.

They had some solid food options such as the sweet potato fries & the wings. The burgers on the otherhand were alright in my opinion & normal french fries too salty, but others at the tables were big fans of them. We mainly opted for finger foods so I'd be curious to try their other food menu items since they sounded solid. 

The service here was great for how busy it was during happy hour, but they really made sure to clean the tables as soon as they saw empty cups & take our orders quickly.
author: Keizzel C.

description:
Louie's is a spot after work meeting spot right between the Financial District and inner SoMa areas.  The crowd is probably 80% finance types, 20% engineers and digital marketing types.

Comfortable bar and plenty of high tables to pull up to for beer or cocktail.

The bar food is REALLY good.  We had Deviled Eggs and the Pastrami Egg Rolls and were very positively surprised by the quality and flavors of the food.  We were also encouraged to try the Sweet Potato Fries and Sweet Lou's Bankok Wings, and will have to do that on the next visit.

Bartender Wendy was our guide to drinks and food, and she's awesome!!
author: Lanny B.

description:
This is a little hidden gem that was walking distance from our hotel.  If you blink you might miss the location, since it looks like it's​ in an alley.  It was a Saturday night, so we knew we wanted to drink and have food, and just about every restaurant we looked at was closing at 10 pm.  10 pm, on a Saturday night, really?  That was crazy for just about every restaurant in San Francisco closes at 10 pm on a Saturday.  

So anyways, this place advertised they close at 2 am which was our kind of spot.  Great little spot for late night drinks and good food and good service.
author: David S.

description:
Louie's is my go-to lunch spot during the week if I'm not eating at my desk. I've taken business colleagues and friends here, and no matter the company, I always feel comfortable and happy. It could be the occasional lunch martini making me feel that way but I'll give some credit to the warm and bustling atmosphere, the mostly amazing waitstaff (it can be a little tough to get a glass of water), and the ever changing menu. 

Recommendations on the current menu: Chinese chicken salad, lamb barbacoa tostadas, the burger, and the southern friend chicken sando. And if you're into wings that have the paddle and drumette attached, those are good too. I have had the occasional miss on food (please don't put non-melty cheese like ricotta on a grilled cheese), and wish they would put their excellently prepared skirt steak back on the menu as a main and an addition for salad, but I'm a fan.
author: Emma L.

description: The menu on their website shows cheaper prices than they actually charge. For example, the website shows the burger for $15 but they actually charge $16. The website shows sweet potato fries for $6 but they actually charge $7. The food and service was fine but I wouldn't buy something from a dishonest business again.
author: Aaron B.

description:
Omfg! I went here for lunch on a whim. I had the burger (without cheese) and it was freaking amazing! I can't even imagine what it would taste like with cheese.

I'm crowning it as the best hamburger that I've ever eaten.
author: George O.

description: I work next door to Louie's so I'm here quite often. It gets super busy most nights so try to come early. I've never had trouble getting a table as I usually hover until I get one. :) The food is pretty decent too. Love their sweet potato fries!
author: Mira B.

description:
Lunch and food review only! However, can't wait to return as a bar customer!

Their menu is drool worthy. Like 100% every item sounds fantastic. BUTTTT, sadly the menu sounded way better than it actually tasted. Not that lunch was bad, but wasn't all that.

We ordered up burrata toast, a grilled cheese, the schnitzel sando's, the avo salads with crispy shrimp, chicken and steak and while it was all solidly priced and good portions, nothing was as gourmet as the menu made it out to be. 

The avo salad with crispy shrimp was literally little bay shrimp, breaded and deep fried, with zero flavor. The burrata toast was really salty and not enjoyable and the grilled cheese sando was pretty pedestrian. Friends who had the schnitzel sando said it was huge and good, but the  roll was overkill and didn't quite compliment the sammy.

Service was great, and the line for a large party of 6 was closer to 30/40 minutes than the original 15/20 we were quoted.

Overall, a solid dive bar serving up probably better bar food with a few beers vs a power lunch with colleagues.
author: Stephanie Y.

description: This place is usually very full after work and I was surprised to see people there on a Saturday night. The food is good, the appetizers, sandwiches and burgers. In fact, I very much enjoy their burgers. They do have salads and fish sandwiches for a healthier option. Even when they're busy, I find their service at the bar and at the tables to be pretty good. It takes a lot of effort to keep a packed bar happy.
author: Jen L.

description:
[In the tune of Drake - Hold on we're going Home]

"I got my eyes on you
Your bookmark is what I see
I want your cocktails and wings endlessly
I can't get over them
They left their mark on me
I want your good service and beer endlessly"

For all the love they showed me on "Instagram" I figure that it was time to return the favor. My interest was sparked when I found out that "Louie's Bar" not only wasn't far off from my usual SF scroll. But "Louie's Bar" was right across the street (kinda) from "Montgomery St Bart" so there wasn't any reason for me not to stop in. Intimate, Sophisticated yet Welcoming. Allow me to tell you a little bit more..

Thursday July 20, 2017
Location: Louie's Bar San Francisco, Ca
People: 1 Adult

Story:
I was feeling good, and in the spirit of being a good "Yelper" I happened to look on my Instagram and saw that "Louie's Bar" showed my some love on one of my latest posts. Lucky me I was hungry and thirsty and wanted to finally say that I visited and had a chance to take in everything. Thanks to a slight look at "Google Maps" I set my course and headed to the bar.

Service/Hospitality:
Of course I had to get my few obligatory "Yelp" photos in. My first encounter with staff here was by way of a "bouncer" the guy was pretty cool, he even asked the usual "Are you a Yelper?" question I tend to get at times because of my snapping a few photos. He even gave a few recommendations of things I should try when I got inside. Inside was indeed packed! but seeing that it was a Thursday evening and that a lot of people were just getting off work and the "SF Giants" were playing....it was to be expected. A waitress walked up to me and asked if I was there to dine or drink, I told here both and she guided me to a table and took my drink order and allowed me some time to look over a menu before she came back and took my food order. She was pleasant the whole time and smiling. Seeing how busy the place was, she could of easily been irritated or annoyed but she didn't show that at all. She knew how to handle it well and that was nice to see. Consistent checking in with me and I have to say the hour or so I was there I was hardly in unattended all the way down to asking me about my food. Great service and hospitality here all around. 

Food/Cleanliness:
Let me say this, the food pictures doesn't do this place justice. This place is a must try! On "Instagram" and even here on "Yelp" this place seems to have a pretty good fan base. But the thing that had me sold the first time I saw pictures of them are their "Sweet Lou's Bangkok Wings" $12 and if you're a wing person as I am then these are sure to become a favorite of yours. Allow me to tell you about them..

SLB Wings - Chinese Black Vinegar, Sesame Seeds, Thai Chili's and Delicious! The 3 nice sized wing portions was fried first and then coated in the sauce which was sweet and slightly tangy. The thai chili's added a nice heat to contrast the sweet and tart taste along with the nutty flavor of the sesame seeds and crunch of the skin and the juiciness of the wings. They were a hit for me and I would totally order them again.

I ordered two beers during my time here, first a Anchor Steam $5 and second a Miller High Life $3. If you've had either beer before you should honestly know how both of them taste. They went well with the wings, especially the Miller High Life. I used the restroom once, and it was pretty spotless I must say, because places that tend to get busy tend to have dirty bathrooms. And I from what I could see from where I was sitting and the table around me. Everything was clean, nice! that means the staff is paying attention to detail and that's a good thing.

Overall: 
I would recommend this place to the "Yelpdom" if you haven't been before. A nice place to join a few friend, coworkers, "Yelpers" for a casual drink and catch a sporting game or some show that MTV always seems to come out with. Intimate and Sexy I would describe this bar. "Louie's Bar" is "San Francisco" which is something I like about visiting SF biased bars and restaurants, because most tend to shy away from just being a "San Francisco Bar" and start to cater towards other cities and or destinations. I see myself as a fan and I'm sure that you will too if you decide to pay them a visit here. So I leave you with this....

"So now "Yelpdom" with an open heart and an empty stomach, I say unto you in the words of my uncle, "Allez Cuisine!"
author: Tre S.

description: The staff here took extra care of us and even whipped up some off menu stuff for our 7 year old daughter. We called after the Giants game to make sure we were allowed in because everywhere around wouldn't let our daughter in after a certain time. They had a reserved table waiting for us. Great customer service.
author: Adam P.

description: One of the few late night bars with food open past 10pm in the Financial District. The Burger with fries was delicious. Industry Laye night crowd.
author: Frank C.

description:
Great place to go for late night drunchies and a solid beer.

Yelped and found this spot serving food around midnight, and I loved how this place is a nicer bar that is clean and not dimly lit for the later bar crowd. The entryway is also pretty obscure, with no Louie's sign outright...just the famous whale. The place has TV's and doesn't play obtrusive dance music overhead. It's my kind of late night bar place.

Service here is so friendly. All of the guys working here are attractive and kind. Our group came here after having a couple drinks in FiDi/SOMA area and we wanted some bar food and to finish off the night a bit sudsy but not drunky. A few of us got a couple more beers, and there were plenty of seats at the bar and at the private tables too. Be polite with the bartenders, and you can taste the beers on tap before getting a pint.

FOOD IS BOMB and made with care. We ordered the deviled eggs (so good, only four) to start with, and we all loved the sweet potato fries and aioli dip. They're thick and yummy and filled with creamy fluffy potato. I heard the wings were a hit, and so was the burger. There are some options for non-meat eaters like myself so have no fear plant eaters! You'll be good here.
author: Jodi H.

description:
I came here with four friends and we were looking for something good to eat and somewhere that offered beers.We were pleasantly surprised to find Louie's Bar tucked away in an alley way. The bar was pretty full when we got there so we killed some time by sipping on some beers and chit chatting until one of the tables opened up. The tables here are first come first serve so keep your eyes peeled! They have a small menu with about 20 items or so and everything looked appealing.  

FOOD:
Chefs Fully Loaded Fries- How can you go wrong with fries? thin cut fries drizzled in ranch,, sprinkled with cheese and bacon. Delish!
Spicy Wings- These wings were crisp on the outside and super juicy on the inside. Quite honestly, this was my favorite out of everything we got. The sauce was lightly tangy/spicy but not drenched.
Tacos- I loved the fresh ingredients in these tacos. The order comes with two tacos and some pico de gallo on the side
Chicken Sandwich with fries- thinly sliced chicken breast with a nice breaded outside and some aioli. Simple and delicious
Baked Potato Skins with quail egg and pork- The potato skins were good but pretty heavy. The time i got to them i was pretty full but i def really liked the quail egg on top

SERVICE: The food came out in a timely manner which was great. You can tell that they were understaffed with the amount of people that were in the bar but overall i would rate the service a 8/10. I def would come back for another late night bite!
author: Samee M.

description:
I had lunch with 4 coworkers at the bar. Two stars only due to the drinks being good. The food is definitely one star. I had the cheesteak. UGH - so nasty. Too much wet cheese and mayo. The contents inside the bread was mostly liquid. Just gross. Two of us ordered the cheesesteak and both of us ate less than half of it. I also had the side salad and the dressing was very bland - almost non-existent. Another co-worker ordered the asparagus grilled cheese sandwich. She really did not like it and again, ate only about half of it. How do you screw that simple sandwich up?

My cheesesteak plus a gin and tonic was $36 after tax and tip. Horrible value. 

Needless to say, we won't be going back there again.
author: Alex L.

description:
Came here for lunch- quick service but sometimes there is a wait so if on time crunch be careful. The menu is great here along with the drinks and atmosphere. Its right in the middle of most things in the city (fidi area). I've also been here for happy hour, its a place you can meet people when crowded. Menu has good food but if youre on a diet prob not your best bet.

I'll take one of everything. :p
author: Amanda M.

description: Super unrated and I feel like not too many people know about it despite its great location and overall amazing service. It's hard to find good happy hours/prices at a lot of the bars in soma which makes Louie's a go to. What really makes this bar amazing is the service, especially the short waitress with brown hair. When I went to close out, she immediately remembered my full name even though I'd only ordered one drink from her. Also the fries are amazing. Only downside is it gets really crowded Friday after work so if you're not there by 5:10 you might have to try a different bar.
author: Sara T.

description: Not a dive bar. This place does not smell bad the service is nice and be on Beyonce is delightful. The best potato skins I've ever had. A very good beer list cool people. This one is the 10 all the way.
author: Wine D.

description:
Oh Louie's Bar--took me a while to find where it was but it is a great dive bar in an alley way in the FiDi. Wouldn't have expected for this bar to be such a pleasant surprise! Affordable bar menu, great drinks, but very loud and kind of crammed environment. First come first serve when it comes to seating. 

Highly suggest trying out their new updated menu: Stuffed ricotta Squash Blossoms, B.B.B.L.A.T (Bacon, Bacon, Bacon, Lettuce, Avocado, Tomato, Letuce, Filone), Gnocchi with a great pork kick, and the Burger are one of the best new options. And the food comes out fast and quick! Just remember to always flag down your waiter as it is a small space and awfully busy especially after 5! 

Pair their food with their extensive drink menu (6 dollar beers, 10 dollar mixed drinks) and this is a perfect dive bar. Again, it can get pretty loud but it gets a little bearable after a few beers or maybe shots in you :) There are also lots of tvs to watch sport games. I wish there were two levels for more space but the lower level is only for the bathrooms!
author: Eric Joseph D.

description: Stopped in here for dinner & drinks after work with a few colleagues. Great location in the Financial District but unfortunately that's where it ends. Service was very slow considering it was a weekday and around 7:30pm - a little later than the happy hour rush. The food was just OK, the sweet potato fries were the best dish of the many items we ordered. Unsure if we will return for a future happy hour with the numerous bars in the area to try.
author: Kris V.

description:
Came here for a work happy hour party. Super busy so it took like 20 minutes for our drinks but once u switched to beer everything came out super fast! 

Overall drinks were good, cocktail server was great, snacks (loaded fries and wings) were tasty and came out quick. 

I'll def check it out another time not on the work dime.
author: Mandi W.

description:
I didn't realize (1) that Louie's Bar is located so conveniently near Montgomery station or (2) that it's in the same family as Box Kitchen. Cool! I decided to come here with a friend for happy hour. Unfortunately I came here from SFO Airport, so I had a moderately sized suitcase with me. This place is not forgiving about that sort of thing. It's so cramped, with tons of tables packed into a tiny space. After accidentally running over the waitress, I finally found a table and a place to stash my suitcase.

My friend was running late, so I was waiting for awhile. The table next to me cleared up, so this group of friends asked me to move to the bar so they could have the tables I was sitting at. Begrudgingly, I said fine, and moved to the bar. The waitress that I ran over graciously offered to put my suitcase in the back, which I greatly appreciated. She wasn't the friendliest waitress I've ever encountered, but it seemed like she was managing the whole floor and the bar was understaffed.

Louie's Bar has a good selection of beers on tap, which is awesome. Love the variety of food they have, too. I ordered the buffalo wings but didn't care for the carrot and celery slaw on top. Ultimately, I would come back here again for both their food and drinks but keep in mind how crowded and claustrophobic this tiny place gets!
author: Stefanie C.

description: The food is soo good! I tried 'the burger', potato skins and chicken wings and it was all delicious. The drinks are also great! Very rare to find a bar with food this good!
author: Asha S.

description:
Came here on a Thursday night and as busy as it was, we scored a table. Sweet! I ordered a delicious cheeseburger and had a glass of wine...and then beer because who has a cheeseburger with wine? 

The service was super friendly and I'm definitely a fan of the music they had. I don't hang out in the city much but I'll be back as quickly as I can!
author: Stacey D.

description: Went here for a 10:30pm dinner on a Monday after a long day. Still were serving food. I had the lamb gyro and it was awesome. Lamb meat balls were tasty and not overly fatty or greasy. The veggies that came in the sandwich were tossed in the tzatziki which was awesome. They seemed to have a great beer list and the boiler makers looked like a great deal...for another night. Oh - they also had a strange movie playing that had beautiful scenery in it. Pretty cool.
author: Danielle B.

description:
Went after work on a Friday and it was absolutely packed. We had to wait for a bit to get seats. Otherwise, good service, prices, and food/drinks. The gravy fries were perfect with beer.

A major plus was they played Indian Jones on the TV's!
author: Josh M.

description:
I've been to Louie's a few times before, but only for drinks - which are great. Nice selection of tap beers as well as some inventive handcrafted cocktails. This visit, my friend and I stopped by after a show for a quick bite before heading to our next destination for the evening...

The burger is to die for! Perfectly cooked on order - the meat was juicy, the bun was fresh and the potato sticks and homemade bacon jam added delectable layers of texture and flavor. Added ages white cheddar to my burger for additional pop. Served with a side of fries, you can't go wrong by ordering it - unless of course you're a non-meat eater.

If the other items on the menu are just as delicious, I'm excited to try something different next time I'm back, but it's going to be hard not to default to the burger. 

Definitely not your average bar burger!
author: kristen c.

description: Homey and vibey spot representing old San Francisco. Good happy hour deals and excellent beer selection.
author: Dave M.

description: Good burger and upbeat vibe. Was a bit loud for me that night but would go again with friends.
author: Hwn T.

description: Went to lunch Friday. The food is great and atmosphere is casual but, lively, service was good.. I had the farro chicken salad, gem lettuce, chicken, avacado, farro tossed in a nice citrus vinaigrette. It was really perfect! My friend each had the fried chicken sandwich and it was big! Looked really good!
author: Teresa B.

description:
I ordered the Monte Cristobal Sando and it was not what i was expecting at all. It was not a typical monte Cristo sandwich that was deep fried with ham etc. it was just basically just a poorly executed grilled cheese. And of top of it the sandwich was smaller than my hand and i am only 5'0. $11! My beer also wasn't cold. The fries were good though. ..

Update: my picture keeps getting deleted...
author: queena k.

description: Tucked away in an alley, I like Louie's Bar because it's a nice spot to drink in the middle of downtown at night. Most of the spots around the area can be too loud and over the top. I find Louie's to be a nice local bar that serves pretty good food late night. You can totally sit at the bar and keep to yourself without issues.
author: Theresa D.

description:
After getting drinks at a nearby bar, we decided to come here for a light nibble.  The place was packed around  6pm but there were a few bar tables open which was fine since we didn't mind standing.  

Potato Skins with Pork Belly and Quail Egg (3) - Palm sized potatoes packed with good flavors.  It's a bit hot once you receive it so I suggest letting it cool down before cupping it in your hand.  The pork belly was a wee bit over cooked but overall, all the ingredients went well together

Great service, good food
author: Linda N.

description:
Hit Louie's for happy hour on a Wednesday evening. Got there about 4p and the place was already happening. Luckily, we were able to score a table when a group of folks departed. Beer selection was very good but you are paying SF prices ($6-9/pint). Someone in the group had some vino and they said it was a good deal - nice body, reasonable price. Also threw down some Buffalo Chicken Wings - nice and meaty!

I'd actually call it an "Upscale Dive Bar" since its not your traditional, super dark & dank hole in the wall. Its got a great atmosphere. Restrooms were a journey down stairs - and while clean, the experience definitely fed the "Dive Bar" scene. 

Aside from it being loud, its worthy of a repeat visit!
author: Kevin K.

description:
Another stop with our son on the underground tour of SF bars, breweries and restaurants - and this was a winner! How can you go wrong with a place that is located in an alley? This is a seriously cool place. No pressure and a lot of people watching as a bonus.

We had burgers (with bacon and cheese, of course) along with an order of tacos. Food came out quickly, was hot and delicious. Cannot remember the beers but they were good as well. If i worked or lived in SF I would definitely stop in here an a regular basis.
author: Dave W.

description:
TL;DR - Great food, but thats about the only thing I like here.

I love the food at Louie's. Its open late and we live a block or so away (super convenient drunchies food)

Upon the two or three times I didn't order my food to-go, I had really unpleasant experiences. 

First of all, the crowd is a hit/miss. This place is usually filled with entitled yuppies who take up two bar seats, one for him and one for his backpack. This is during happy hour when its  stupid crowded. Then you have your already-drunk-at-5pm people. Yikes. I almost got smacked in the face as I was leaving because this guy was stumbling around in circles flailing his arms. 

Also, I was charged incorrectly on my bill. When we sat down, we actually asked our server about the happy hour drinks and at the end, she charged us way higher. It was crowded and I couldn't find my server so I just let it go.

Anywho. Definitely order the food here. Wings, fries, burgers, ALL GOOD. Just.... get it to go if you can. Or be careful about your bill. Whatever.
author: Crystal Z.

description:
Honestly, if my friend didn't host her going away here I would have no idea there was a bar back here but clearly, the word is out because it was packed! 

Boilermaker combos are great and their selection of draft beers was plentiful 

Seating for large groups can be difficult so beware

Full bar for non-beer drinkers 

Overall Thoughts

Not too shabby of a place to grab drinks with friends if you are in the neighborhood
author: Eddie W.

description: I've been here twice now while visiting SF. It's a great hole in the wall bar. Their burger is fantastic! Fries are decent frozen fries. On my most recent visit my food took awhile to come out because a large party arrived right before me. The staff was very apologetic, kept me in the loop about why my food was slow, and gave me a drink on the house to make up for it. Great customer service! My one major complaint about this place is that there seems to be a steady waft of smoke coming in from out front. Other than that though, no complaints. I was in on a Monday night and the place was packed at 8pm.
author: Ryan L.

description:
This is a chill restaurant during the day and a fun bar at night. The alley might look a little sketch and the door to this place is tiny but there's also a downstairs. They don't take reservations but I called ahead to request a table for ~12 and they were amazing at organizing things to accommodate us during lunch time! Not too much seating or space though 

It's SF hipster kind of upscale ambiance. Like rustic vibe but still nice.

Claimed to be the best burger in San Francisco. Idk if it was, but it was the best burger I've had in a while! Super juicy, super flavorful, and also looks perfect.

This place is owned by the same people who run the box kitchen! So if you like food there you'll love the sit-down version of a similar menu.
author: Grace P.

description:
Came here earlier this year with my coworkers to grab drinks after work. I ask the Asian bartender if they serve Anchor Steam. She points up at the menu and says "all the beers we serve is on the menu." I look up and see that Anchor Steam is on the menu. I told her that I would like to get an Anchor Steam, she served me my beer.... 

I'm guessing that this place gets a lot of business and my business or satisfaction is not a priority...
author: D H.

description: I am new to the area, and I was so excited to do there for dinner and drinks with a few friends. Jade the server forgot my husband's food order. We all ate and after we finished then we all stayed so he could eat as it came out much later. The odd thing was they charged us for the food they forgot.
author: Heather P.

description: I absolutely love Louie's.  I often came here with friends and coworkers to unwind after work, and occasionally take visiting friends or family here lunch when they're in town.  There's always a great vibe and it's a great place to catch a Warriors or (SF) Giants game.  The drink combos are pretty reasonable, and the food's great for either lunch or dinner.  Easily my favorite place to go in the downtown/FiDi area on weekdays.
author: Shane G.

description:
This is a San Francisco best! Small, cool vibes, and Cape Fear. I needed a spot to kill time after work hours and quickly found this speakeasy down the alley. It was already crowded at 4:55pm, but I found a single seat and was welcomed by one of the 3 savvy bartenders right away. What to order? Pastrami egg rolls...like, a reuben wrapped as an egg roll with the yummiest sauce ever - I need more. I didn't get to the potato skins with pork belly or the avocado toast, but I can't wait to go back and try. The crowd was a rush of professionals, and after realizing I was watching Cape Fear for the past 20 minutes, 3-4 of us struck up a conversation on the bizarre social experiment of watching an early 90's horror film that was happening during happy hour. 

This place has certainly dialed in on the SF experience, and I can't wait to go back.
author: Ana M.

description:
This place is a great hidden gem. At least it was hidden for me since I had some trouble finding it. It's located on a side street, but it's totally worth finding.

I was in San Francisco for a work trip and after doing some exploring I decided to see what was good for food in the area. I think Louie's was one of the top choices so I decided to go. What a cool place! It's definitely got the dive bar feel, but it was one of my favorite things about it. It also had the Sunday Night Football game on so that didn't hurt either. Full bar, great beer and cocktail selection and the bartender was incredibly friendly.

The food menu featured all of your typical bar-food which was exactly what I was craving. I went with the buffalo wings and was not disappointed. They were honestly some of the best wings I have had in quite some time. Crunchy, flavorful, oh how I wish I could get them again! 

This is one of the coolest bars I've ever been to and I wish that I could more often. If you ever find yourself in San Fran, definitely check this place out. I know I'll be back, that's for sure.
author: Seth C.

description: This is a great little gem hidden in an alley way down a block from The Palace hotel we were staying at.  An old brick building that the whalers would come to after a day at sea. Great atmosphere,  great service and great food. Bar tender Boots was so friendly and an encyclopedia of knowledge regarding eateries in the area. Just a heads up, the pork shoulder tacos are great and oh so spicey, my favorite.  Keep up the good work Louie's!
author: Tamara H.

description: Excellent delicious food and service, people who've reviewed this as a "dive bar" with their entitled complaints are interesting bunch. It's a good down to earth unpretentious cozy clean spot.
author: Natasha C.

description:
Came here for dinner since we were nearby. Very fun bar with excellent food!  The burger and fries were so delicious; potato skins just OK in my opinion (didn't like the white sauce).  

Extensive whiskey and gin menu.  Great price for beers as well.

There are 2 TVs but they seem to be linked so have to show the same channel?  A nearby patron was definitely upset and the owner seemed to give very little care to her...

The only negative was the service.  Waitress took a very long time to acknowledge us and take our order.

Despite this, the food and drink menu were great so I will definitely be back.
author: Siv L.

description:
Came here for lunch on a weekday. As with any downtown lunch spot, it's extremely crowded and loud between noon-1pm. 

I was seated promptly at 1 and ordered.

BLT-  there's A LOT of bacon, so much that some of it had to be picked out.
Chicken sandwich - lots of mushroom and cheese, chicken wasn't dry

Total came to $25 not including tip
author: Angelica C.

description: Best burger in SF. Fries are top notch. Good prices too. For $17 you get a fully decked burger (avocado, bacon, egg, blue cheese, and some tomato spread) with fries. Whenever I'm in the city and crave a burger, I go here. Only downside is it's always PACKED!
author: Matt H.

description: Stopped in here by chance and was grateful we did. Excellent food, taste & quality. As well a good selection of craft beers, including a sour that I quite enjoyed. Vibe is cozy, warm and chill. We sat up at the bar and had a great time, will go back!
author: Theresa F.

description:
Attractive space with a great ambiance. Not too crowded. Fast, efficient service. 

The food was yummy - although I wouldn't loved a few more options to share ... looking forward to having a real meal here.
author: Kim C.

description:
At 10 PM we were still hungry and found that Louie's was walking distance from the hotel and the kitchen was open late. Louie's is a solid choice as a late night dining option with reasonably priced drinks and good service.

Hidden on the dimly lit Stevenson, we found Louie's and entered to find a long bar on one brick wall, tables along the other brick wall, and an open kitchen in the back. We sat ourselves at a table unsure if there was a cocktail. So I went to the bar to order a beer from the complete list on the chalk board and grab a menu. The bartender was busy muddling an old fashion but still acknowledged me which confirmed that he could multi task and we would receive sufficient service.

The menu has plenty of your typical bar food but is kicked up with special ingredients and touches to make it more gourmet. Their signature item is their burger which none of us were in the mood for at the time. I ordered the short rib "French dip" accompanied with a pint of guinness. The braised beef elevated this sandwich above your typical French dip, but I could have done without the arugula. Also ordered were the lamb gyro and the buffalo wings which were both delicious and finished completely. Though I'm not sure the purpose of serving the wing tip, it never gets touched because there's nothing edible on it. The seasoned fries were fresh and were cooked to order.

I wouldn't classify Louie's as a dive bar because of the elevated food, atmosphere, and service which would make it definitely worthy of a another visit if I'm in the area again.
author: Arthur M.

description:
Came by Tuesday, June 16th around 5:45pm to watch the Golden State Warriors, Game 6. My friend staked out a standing table by the bar around 4:30pm, so we had our own space to order food and drinks. (Well, as much space as you can have in a super crowded bar.)

*Guinness - Dublin, Ire 4.2% ($6)
*Buffalo wings: sriracha buffalo sauce, carrots, celery and ranch ($10)
*Potato skins: crispy pork belly, charred green onions, crema, quail egg ($10)

The potato skins are delicious! Crispy pork belly and a quail egg?! Yes please! The buffalo wings were good too. A friend of mine thought they were too spicy, but I thought they had a nice kick. The slaw on top was also nice and refreshing.

It was a sight to see all the fans when the Warriors won the championship. The bartenders even sprayed champagne at the crowd in celebration. Although I appreciated the gesture as I'm a huge warriors fan, don't wear anything that's leather or can't get wet! It took away from my celebration as I wasn't ready for that. (I know, first world problems.)

I'd love to come back and check out Louie's when it isn't jam packed. There were other dishes on their menu that looked delicious!
author: Elena N.

description:
A good bar hiding behind market Street. Good vibe. Good bartenders. Not many food options, but I gad the salmon burger and it was really good! 

The special cocktails are pre made and poured out of a bottle, which was a disappointment. Freshly made cocktails are something else. But they were good nonetheless.

Would visit again!
author: Ankit A.

description: This place is the best. I love boots. He makes the best old fashions and such a good People person. A great hidden gem.
author: Jesse M.

description:
Hidden bar that's located right in FiDi alley and serves as a great spot to get your drink on after the working hours or during as well. 

There are bar dibs for munching.

Sports tv available to watch the hype of games going on.

Convenient place for the workday flow on drinks and dibs.
author: Tiffany D.

description: From Julie and Kristina: We work in the city and have come here many times. We don't come here because it's the most convenient for where we both work; we come here because the drinks, food and staff are phenomenal. The bartender, Jacob, may be the bar's greatest asset. He is kind, friendly, and extremely talented. He makes the big city feel like a small town, where you can feel familiar and welcome. It's a rare find just off of Market Street.
author: Julie B.

description: Food was just decent and the service mediocre.  Sat at the bar for lunch and had a few snacks and sandwiches.  Only thing to rave about is the chicken sandwich which was juicy and flavorful with the perfect bread to protein ratio.  The chicken crisps and lamb tostada were slightly underwhelming.  Would probably come back for a drink and a sandwich.
author: Patrick C.

description:
Ah Louie's, you saved my neck!  I was in San Francisco recently on a business trip, and got tied up late in meetings.  At 11 PM, I finally walked out of my meetings starving and into an absolute downpour of rain!  Surprisingly, it's not easy to find a spot to serve you food at 11 PM in San Francisco, so it took a bit of searching to find Louie's (Louie's actually serves food until 1 AM).

10 minutes later, I showed up at Louie's door soaked like a drowned rat!  On walking in, I was greeted by the bartenders, who quickly plied me with a nice microbrew and a menu.

I ordered the burger, and it was a godsend at this hour!  A nicely done burger with a fried egg on top, a nice soft bun, and a heaping pile of really good fries on the side. 

They also have an extensive selection of beers, so after wolfing down the burger and sampling several different beers, I was happy and (mostly) dry.

As mentioned earlier, the bartenders were also very friendly and welcoming, which I appreciated in my altered mental state.

A great evening in a fun little dive bar.
author: Frank W.

description: Finally made it here after working literally 30 seconds from the spot for the last year and a half. My bar crawl with a few co-workers started here and it was fantastic. We were able to snatch a table early on and never had to wait around. I drank some fantastic beer and ordered The Burger. The burger was great. A good blend of meat, bread and egg on it was a winner for me and paired with my beer it was good. I will say the staff was friendly and although it was slightly too loud inside for me I enjoyed the laid back atmosphere and the sort of hard to find gem of a place that it is. Overall, fantastic spot that I will definitely come back to again in the future.
author: James R.

description:
Went here with my brother to watch a football game on a Monday night. It is definitely hidden away in the financial district, but it is such a cool bar!

We started off with drinks, which oddly enough, they don't really have a happy hour? But according to locals, the prices of drinks are relatively cheap for a bar in that area. The beers ranged from roughly $3-$6. I got cidre, and even that was only $6. Their special cocktails however were all $10 (yikes!). I ended up getting their tacos as well and it was really yummy!

I'd definitely recommend this place to anyone in the area, their beer selection is amazing, the food is yummy and sufficient, and the staff is very friendly.
author: Rachael J.

description: The food here was awesome!! I loved the Shishito Peppers and Artichoke dip. Both dishes tasted delicious and very unique.
author: Amber F.

description:
I'm upping my rating of Louie's to 5 stars after another great experience here last Friday night. 
After sipping on one too many strong post-work cocktails my bf and I were starving and looking for something good, affordable, and quick. Louie's was close by so we wandered over and found it to be not super busy for a Friday night (yay). We quickly grabbed a high top in the back and were immediately greeted by the server who wiped down the little bit of residue from previous customers (thank you!) We both went for the stone enjoy by ($7) and stared with some garlic fries (sans cheese - because, vegan). Our beers came almost immediately and the server grabbed our entree order. 
The food came out lightning fast (thank god because we were starvinggg). I got the Falafel wrap made vegan without cheese or tzatziki sauce with a side salad and my bf went for the ruben with a side of fries. The falafel wrap was sooooo good. A super soft pita warm pita wrapping up some delicious balls of falafel with greens, also I appreciate the tin foil wrapping to keep this goodness nice and warm while I munch away. My bf devoured his ruben and said it was super tasty. I thought the fries were nice, personally I would go for the sweet potato fries next time, but that is just my preference. I also really enjoyed the side salad with my wrap, most places a "side salad" is usually just lettuce tossed in some dressing, but this one was dolled up with some cherry tomatoes, cucumbers and topped with crispy onion strings YUM. 
In all I am impressed with this bar and the fantastic service. Our server on Friday (Jane?) was great. I was a server for years and the style of bar this is poses a challenge for servers sometimes. People seat themselves, get inpatient, order from the bar, take over your section. But man, these girls are great. Quick to notice new customers, get the drink order, check in for second rounds, clear glassware, etc. bravo!
author: Kelsey B.

description: Best dive bar in the city. I literally have to tell the bartender NOT to make my drink too stiff. And delicious bites: Louie's chicken crisps, all the different fries, and churros. Yummmm!
author: chris k.

description: I am here now. Al nice enough bar and the food and beer selection is good. Looks like a place that would be fun at 1 am BUT at 9 pm the server and bartender could not be bothered and the music sounds like a version of CBS Idea of indie rock -shit. Bartender wearing coaches shorts and drinking. Candy Slice the server won't make eye contact . You guys are doing a poor job. Come to Seattle and we will show you how service is done.
author: John B.

description: Nice little hidden bar, easy to walk to.  Good menu. We were able to sit and talk and enjoy a good beer selection.
author: Shellie N.

description:
Loud.  Crowded.  Greasy. 

Perfect for an after work quick bite. 

Prices are decent and the beers are a plenty.

We had the Asian wings, loaded fries, and artichoke hearts. All fried but all yummy. 

The bartenders also had great attitudes and managed to service everyone even though it was pretty packed. 

Solid 3.5!
author: Cindy C.

description: Hidden gem alert! Food here is phenomenal. Had the burger and potato skins and both were on point! Cheap drinks too.
author: Holly M.

description:
I've found myself here many times after a long night of being out or if I'm trying to get my evening started. This is a great place for either of these options. It's a really chill atmosphere here, really chill and friendly service from bartenders and waitresses. Their cocktails and beer selection is great. It seems like they change their menu often which is always good. 

The best thing about this place is definitely their food. POTATO SKINS POTATO SKINS POTATO SKINS. Did I say potato skins? These things are the perfect late night snack. It's nice and hearty and will bring some life into you. The pork is flavorful and the white sauce is yummy and the egg just tops it off. 

This place also has other food options here but be sure to try the potato skins. This place is also cool if you just want to watch a sports game since they have two tv's. A great spot and I highly recommend to come here out of the many bars in the city.
author: Melissa M.

description:
Update: taking them up to five stars - love this little place!

This is my new happy hour spot since I'm now working in 555 Market. 

Important: If you work in 555 Market take the elevator to G and then exit out of the garage and you're literally at Louie's front door. No need to walk all the way around the block! For a girl that hates walking in heels and also loves drinking, this is KEY. 

I came here with three co-workers last night (Thursday) and it was busy but most people were gone by 7pm. Even though it was packed there were some seats and the service was still fast. They have TVs if you're into watching the game and also have lots of food. I didn't eat anything but I kept smelling the sweet potato fries and came very close to ordering some. The burger looked solid too. 

They card at the door so don't be that girl/guy that never carries your ID. Come with a friend or co-worker you want to get to know better because my G&T was nice and strong.
author: Alison C.

description: This place is awesome (if you go at the right time - before 11am and after 2pm for lunch if you don't want to wait). They have THE BEST BURGER you can think of. Juicy, tender, the whole 9-yards! GET THE BURGER! The only reason I take off a star is the wait; but it's worth it!!!!
author: Erik M.

description:
I never gave much thought to Louie's since I associated it with networking mixers and other awkward events where I had to mingle. You know how to mingle, don't you? You just put your lips together and kiss ass. Yeah, I guess that's why Louie and I had a period of estrangement until somebody told me it was a good place to grab a bite for lunch. But it's a bar. Doesn't that mean I'd be having jalapeño poppers and pretzels and come back to work smelling of Lucky Strikes? No, it turns out the same guys who own the Tempest and the Box Kitchen on Natoma took over this alleyway spot on Stevenson, and the same kind of creative bar bites came over as well.

On my first visit, I went solo and was surprised at how big their lunch menu was (photo: http://bit.ly/1FdR8Zq). I ordered the $10 Hot Pastrami Sando, which was a lovely, hot mess of pastrami, pickles and shredded cabbage piled high on a sourdough English muffin. It was dripping with horseradish aioli and the whole creation was gooey with melted provolone cheese. I was semi-good and had the salad on the side instead of the fries, and it was drenched in a tangy Caesar dressing (photo: http://bit.ly/1pa6Xyi). I was pleasantly surprised at how delicious it was, and as decadent as the pastrami was, it was just the right size not to overwhelm me with post-lunch guilt. At least not enough for me to be concerned with pastrami breath back at work.

Weeks later, Jamie W. had discovered Louie's on his own and said he had the best burger there. OK then. So back for a second visit last week, we went at the height of Happy Hour thinking it would be insufferable in there. It wasn't. Even though it was fairly crowded, we had plenty of elbow room at the bar to eat and have a beer this time. Naturally I ordered the $11 Burger with bacon bourbon BBQ jam, potato sticks, aioli and arugula, all of it housed in a potato pepper bun (photo:  http://bit.ly/1BZj9HX). Done medium rare, it lived up to the hype. It was bar-friendly good, nice and juicy and with just enough creaminess between the jam and the aioli to make it a finger-licking affair.

But no salad this time as I indulged in the $6 Garlic Fries with fried herbs, sliced peperoncini, Parmesan and garlic confit. I washed it down with a nice $6 pint of Guinness which evoked warm memories of Dublin for me (photo: http://bit.ly/1torISn). Jamie changed his game and went for the $11 Chicken Parmesan Sando which took a breaded chicken breast and decorated it with squash noodles, tomato basil sauce, cherry peppers, fried capers, and creamy burrata oozing out of a soft rosemary slipper roll (photo: http://bit.ly/1FdRjnt). He wet his whistle with a tasty $7 Chocolate Pumpkin Porter direct from an Alaskan brewery. I have to tell you Louie's really exceeded my expectations for a watering hole since their bites compare favorably to a lot of the food served up on the major thoroughfares. And no mingling necessary.

FOOD - 4 stars...bar bites that are definitely far more than you would expect between the sandos and the burger
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...well, it's still a dark bar but not an unpleasant one
SERVICE - 4 stars...found the servers and bartenders fast, efficient and interactive when asked
TOTAL - 4 stars...Louie Louie Louie, Louie... Louie Louie Lou-I... Louie Louie Louie... Louie Louie, you're gonna belch
author: Ed U.

description:
TLDR: Reasonably priced drinks and really good fries.

Came here after another bar. We had already had a few drinks so I just ordered some wine. They had a lot of food options and we ended up getting two plates of their fries because they were so good. They were nice and crisp on the outside but soft on the inside. I usually don't like seasoned fries but the seasoning on these were pretty good.

The place had a grubby vibe to it, but was pretty clean overall. It was kind of hard to find and we ended up walking down an alleyway by accident. The Chinese restaurant on the corner kind of eclipses it, so you have to look hard to see it.
author: Melissa Z.

description:
Great atmosphere, great food, great service 

We never had to wait more than 2 minutes to get a drink at the bar which is unheard of on a Saturday. 

The food is so good! We ordered the ranch fries, loaded fries, potato skins and fried artichokes and everything was Fuego McFuefue. 

Even though it was a busy Saturday night after Super Bowl city, our table was always cleared.
author: Tonni R.

description:
The owners at Tempest took over management at Louie's Bar in March. So that means since I'm a fan of Tempest, I'm a default fan of Louie's Bar. (The chef for Box Kitchen is the same chef here!) The drinks and food menu are all pretty similar, and the great thing is the venue is a bit more modern and classier. (It's also located in a not-as-shady-looking neighborhood, so I'm a fan of that.)

- Fish sliders: I'm not usually a fan of sliders, but these were AMAZING. I love that they put corn in these bad boys! 
- Potato skins: Really thankful I didn't get too drunk to try these famous potato skins this time. Potato with pork belly topped with a quail egg - do I need to say more?

Beers are $5-7 here so you won't break your bank. Bartenders are super chill and awesome. I'll definitely be back for happy hour or any hour! :)
author: Christine S.

description: I've visited this place on three different occasions. Twice after work and once for lunch. I would suggest arriving after 1pm during the weekday if your plan is not to get swept up in the lunch rush. I'm not a vegetarian but I ended up ordering the veggie burger with fries. The patty alone was absolutely amazing and it didn't crumble at all. If you want a recommendations for a drink, their whiskey mules and whiskey sours are pretty great too.
author: Mikki M.

description:
If this was simply for the food, it would be a strong four, maybe even a five. Damn fine burger, especially for the price. Tacos are really, really good - great heat, and overflowing. But the bar, loud as all hell, and full of your stereotypical SOMA "young professionals". Expect to have to yell at your companions, sitting right next to you. It's not the establishment's fault, the majority of its clientele are annoying, but the judgement of the environment is part of this review. 

Might stop by to grab lunch, take out, possibly, but to sit for a meal after the sun goes down, or drink for happy hour, nope. Great food + crappy environment = three stars.
author: Darrell L.

description:
Louie's is an awesome little gem in FiDi; it wasn't packed with suits and there was no hipster "use your iPhone to pre-check-in before you leave your office" so you'll actually get a seat. It's a no-frills bar with friendly bartenders and good beers on tap for reasonable prices (draft Prairie Bomb! for $8). What more could you ask for?

P.S. did I mention they have Prairie Bomb on tap?
author: Akash K.

description:
Shhhh. Don't tell anyone this place is the bomb.

Amazing selection of beer and ales on tap (love the allagash!)

Great selection of whiskeys and libations.

Fantastic food: Killer burger, awesome wings, great tacos.

Great atmosphere!

Oh shit this place is now crowded never mind about the secret.
author: David G.

description:
Tucked away inside the Stevenson alley, Louie's is a nice off the beaten path location that doesn't attract a lot of foot traffic.  I've been her two times already and usually the main floor is usually pretty packed.  They have a very good beer selection there from heavy darks to lighter stuff.  I usually like to drink good craft beer from lights to darks, pale to smooth.  Their food menu is also a step above other places in that they have the shareable items like popcorn, fries, wings, and potato skins(with pork belly and a quail egg? Super good!) but also full on sandwich/burger items as well for someone who wants more of a meal.  

The music also is pretty good here.  Although it's really loud(not a surprise, it's a bar) but the type of music was up my alley.  They played mostly 80's/90's stuff so I heard MC Hammer, TLC, and Run DMC amongst the many old school hits during my brief two hours here.

It's great to find a place that offers decent food with drinks as well as some very cool big screen TV's on the wall.  They look new because the football game that was being aired that night looked amazing!  Or maybe that was the booze making it look amazing...either way, I had a good time and I'm going back.
author: Ben H L.

description:
Loovvveee louie's! the beeers are diverse, and cocktails yummy, and not overly expensive. the place is alwayyyyys super packed though! and it gets loud, but that's all in the atmosphere :) 

i always order the garlic fries and bangkok wings - jjust so nomsies! have also tried the loaded fries, beets salad (mehh), and a few sandwiches. overall solid spot for a quick late night bite, or hanging out for hourssss! hehe.
author: Christina L.

description: Legit Bar food, Friendly bartenders and cheap drink specials. A Fi-Di Staple.  What more can you ask for?
author: Jason L.

description:
Stumbled upon this place with a friend and I have to say, it's pretty neat. I would've never came here if it weren't for him - because it's on this tiny little street (whowouldvethunk). Anyways, it's an intimate bar and I enjoyed the atmosphere. I don't recall them having many cocktails, but then again I was on that buzz flow. What's pretty cool is that they have three different beer and shot combos. Who's going to complain about that? 

The kitchen closes LATE so that's a major bonus. Best believe I scarfed those loaded fries down. No shame in my game.
author: Kenitha Y.

description: Easily could be 5 stars. Gave 3 due to 1 server for the entire place and we felt super rushed and apologetic for asking for anything. Great dive bar. My advice is sit at the bar as it seems like you would get better service.
author: Tony B.

description:
The food is great. I have came here plenty of times and the food is constantly great. 

BUT I do have to say there is one server there, named Aiyisha who is constantly rude. Every time me and a group of friends come in she has an attitude. If you are in the service industry you should have a great a positive attitude, but she does not. She would take our menus away before we even get a chance to order and she looks at us reluctantly every time she walks by our table. 

She told us before that she is upset that she doesn't get a tip from us. But when you are not a good server you don't deserve it. 

Everyone else is great but her! It's unfortunate that she ruins the mood.
author: Maggie N.

description:
I was walking along stevenson not really sure where this bar was. I walked past it a few times and missed it. The entrance is tiny and easy to miss. Look for "55"... if you see "49" you've gone too far. 

We walked in on a monday night to a bar that had a few patrons, but wasn't completely full. They have a good beer selection and some non-standard hard alcohol brands. 

+ Variety of drinks and beers
+ Reasonable prices
+ No CC Minimum
+ Food served until 1am
+ The food selection is just a bit pricey, but it looks really really good.
+ Plenty of seating
+ Bartender was nice

- Bathrooms are downstairs, the urinal is right next to the sink. it's a bit awkward.

I think when I start work around the corner, this will be my go to bar after work!

Recommended and I"ll be back.
author: Kaje Y.

description:
Why didn't anyone tell me about this Bar before

Was looking to change up the coworker kick-it spot, and being the resident yelper at work, I consulted my friend Yelp and found this gem. Because it's a bar, it's wonderful to be a block away from Bart. You can find it in the alley, labeled with a sign outside with a big whale

It's adequately sized, a pretty long bar, standing room with standing tables, and couple sets of tables with chairs. There are 2 TVs with sports playing for you fans. The staff is really nice and check up on their patrons regularly.

There is a pretty good selection of craft beer and cocktails. Being a beer drinker, of course I needed to explore the menu a bit. Delicious IPAs, I was able to try the one from Seattle and the Double IPA this time. The prices are good as well. Being a coworker affair, we were buying a lot of drinks. The shots were pretty generous too.

The icing on the cake is that they have food as well, and pretty good food at that. I personally wanted to have The Burger, with the optional fried egg. I'll have to say, I wasn't expecting much from "Bar Food", but  it was delicious! Well seasoned, cooked perfectly.

I'd love to come back to try more of the menu, drinks and food. Would recommend to anyone!
author: Robert O.

description: Great cozy hip little place downtown. Came on a quiet night. Our bartender Elizabeth was super cool and accommodating. Awesome flavorful burger, great liquor selection.
author: Bryan D.

description:
This place is poppin' Friday evenings after work. They have a good selection of drinks for during happy hour deal. 

The atmosphere of this bar is very laid back and mellow. I've come here a couple of times with friends to get some drinks and chill. I've also got the chance to try the burger and it's sooo good! Order it medium-rare and you won't be disappointed. The burger also comes with french fries!

The waiters here are super friendly and fun! If I was still working in the city, I would definitely come here more often!
author: Nicole C.

description: Amazing girl behind the bar, great selection of beer and awesome atmosphere. Went there on Sunday night and even though it was pretty empty around 11 pm it was a great spot to have a few beers. It is located in an alley which adds to the charm. Overall great night at Loui's and I will visit again on my next trip to San Francisco.
author: Srdjan T.

description:
5 stars because I would say that this bar has the best selection of food. I only got the chance to eat the loaded fries which I HIGHLY RECOMMEND, but looking at the table next to me, the baked potato with sour cream looked delicious!! It was a tough choice picking from the dozen or so food choices. Originally I wanted to get the Cajun fries because it was so popular on yelp, but the bartender said they constantly change their menu and it probably changed 2-3 times since they had Cajun fries. 

The service was good, the waitresses always came by to pickup any dishes that weren't used on our table. The venue was pretty small though... Imagine a narrow bar-- that's it right there.
author: Sabrina L.

description:
GOOD BAR FOOD
(3.75 stars)

Small bar, good food, and chill.

- FOOD, good
- PRICES, fair
- SERVICE, not the best
- AMBIANCE, pub-like

Rated the place based on food, not by service because THATS a different story. Been here back in 2006 bar hopping with friends after work. Haven't been back since, until 2013 and it looks the same. However, their menu changed and for the better!! Decided to try the menu for a late lunch and avoid the prime lunch crowd and the after work crowd. Wasn't greeted, had to seat myself and look dumb-founded before getting food. They say food is quick but i waited 25 minutes for a burger and fries (and the place was NOT packed at all). I'm not a burger person, i repeat I'm not a burger person.... but the burger was tasty. No water refill and no asking if everything is okay after my food was dropped off. Sorry, tipped cheap because service was cheap.

HEFER STATUS

THE BURGER ($11) - Bacon bourbon BBQ Jam, Potato Sticks, Aiou, Arugula, Potato Pepper Bun. IT WAS TASTY!!! I went for medium-well on the patty and still came up very juice... very very juicy. The bacon bourbon BBQ jam reminded me of the sauce of baked beans. The potato sticks in the burger were a great twist, added a nice crunchy texture. Arugula gave it a more milder taste than lettuce, but I appreciated it - however towards the end I got sick of the arugula taste. The bun just tasted like a bun.

SIDE OF FRIES - regular fries. I wasn't charged so I assume the burger came with it or I just got hooked up because they felt sorry for me.

Will I be back? I'd like to try other things on the menu. 

Until the next review....
author: Jane A.

description: One of my favorite bars in FiDi if not in SF. It became my favorite hang out happy hour spot when I first moved to SF and started my job in downtown. Time has gone by and I will always find a way to come back here. Since the renovation the food has been spot on especially the sweet potato fries with siracha ketchup and potato skins with a quail egg. It's smaller but intimate and has TVs. I love love Cindy the bartender who always has a great attitude and has been serving me since 2011. Writing this review makes me want to come back.
author: Linda L.

description: What a gem in fidi! Amazing place for after work drinks, such a relaxed and unassuming bar. Really chill atmosphere w great drink selections and friendly, all around nice bar tenders and HH crowd!
author: Joy-Alonica B.

description:
We had our wedding reception at Louie's Bar in SF. The price was right, the food was beyond what we expected, the service was amazing, the drinks were mind blowing. They made our special night better than we expected and treated us like family. I love this restaurant and they are great for events with groups around 70 people. Thank you everyone!!!

The chef build us a custom menu that included over 8 items. It kept our quests on their toes and their bellies happy. In addition, the bar manager created two custom drinks for the night to match our personalities. I could go on.... :D
author: Rupa S.

description:
This is a cool little spot, tucked away in a semi-seedy alley. At 10pm they were about 1/3 full and pretty responsive as we came in and were asked to find a spot wherever we'd like. 

Ordering food has to be done at the bar after 10pm, but since they weren't busy the waitress took our drink and food order. My Shrimp Po'Boy was "OK", but my lady's Squash Blossoms were fantastic. 

They also had Coming To America playing on their two TVs, big bonus, haha. They played classic hip hop music over their speakers which was a welcomed surprise. 

Good service, super chill atmosphere, good beer, and decent food. I'll definitely be back.
author: Daniel B.

description:
ATMOSPHERE
Cute little hidden bar pub with good barfood menu lots of tvs great for watching games
author: Angela L.

description: What a DIVE. Burger was decent, but staff was downright unfriendly. Pork tacos were wet and greasy. The stairway walls which lead to the restrooms was disgustingly filthy, and the restrooms themselves were not much better. Lots of drunk people staggering around, watching the Giants lose yet again. Very dreary place. Depressing.
author: David R.

description:
Great chill place for a drink and to catch up with some friends. Was in town for two days and only had a short period to catch up. This was the perfect spot for it. 

It's a little hard to spot , but is a pleasant surprise when you get there. I  was there on a Monday night so it wasn't so busy as others have described. If you're in the area drop by.
author: Christopher C.

description: This is a very chill dive bar with the fanciest potato skin I have ever had- with pork belly inside and a quail egg on the top! I have always been a potato fan but this potato, man, just broaden my horizon. I didn't like the buffalo wing that much but I heard the Bangkok wing is better. I will come back and try that some other time.
author: Sophia H.

description:
If you don't mind noise and a crowd, Louie's is the BEST. If you do mind, then what were you thinking going to a dive bar anyways? 

Make the ordering simple, get their burger. It'll be mouthwatering. 

Make the timing simple, go during a Giants / GSW game.

Eat, drink, cheer.
author: Tristan B.

description:
For starters walking into this bar was a trip, at first glance it's just a dark entrance in an alley off of Market but when you enter you're taken to a dive bar that has great music, great food and great people.

We found a spot at the bar & our bartender was an awesome guy, knew the beer menu well and we ordered their red cider & a Guinness. The cider was served in a goblet & for $8 it sure got me a little tipsy.

As for the food we ordered their potato skins which were hands down the best I've ever had. Topped with crispy pork belly, crema & a quail egg it was definitely quality food. After devouring those we ordered the barbacoa tacos & the sweet chicken wings. The barbacoa was cooked to perfection, juicy and flavorful while the chicken wings were HUGE, full of flavor & perfectly crisp on the outside while juicy on the inside.

We moved from the bar to a high top and the only reason why I didn't rate Louie's 5 stars is because the service was a little slow, understandable for a busy bar but even when it slowed we had a difficult time catching our waitress.

All in all a great place to visit for out of towners and locals alike, we'll definitely be back!
author: Rebecca G.

description:
I can't get enough of Louie's! For HH, late night drinks and bites or to watch a sporting event on TV - Louie's has quickly become one of my go-tos for the aforementioned, and very deserving of a five star rating.

There's too many good things to say about about Louie's I'm afraid I don't know where to begin. Here goes...

SERVICE is off the charts great!  The bartenders are friendly, fun and have your best interest at heart.  Eric is my fave and is the best example of the quality service.

DRINKS are amazing. When I go there I usually get one of their shot and a beer offerings (specifically a shot of Bulliet and a High Life), but they do cocktails well, too.  A friend of mine swears by their margaritas and I quite enjoyed a manhattan.  Nice they have a good bourbon selection (most if not all of my faves represented) and I'm told a pretty good selection of tequila, too.  If beers are your thing, they have a sizable rotating list of beers on tap, some common and less common varieties. 

FOOD is always on point! Served quick and fresh, I'm always happy with my order.  Some of my faves are the Bangkok wings, loaded fries, salt and vinegar fries and the burger.  I'm a simple gal when it comes to bar food preferences, but rest assure these items are not just your standard bar offerings.  

Go to Louie's the next time you find yourself in the SOMA looking for a bar with a fun vibe that serves delicious food and drink with friendly and efficient staff.  Worth noting, the kitchen serves food till 1:00am - what?!
author: Marie B.

description:
My husband and I came here on Friday at 11:30am for a quick lunch before heading home. We were greeted and seated promptly. Great atmosphere!
We ordered the grill cheese and cauliflower soup, and the burger with fries~ I discovered cauliflower soup isn't my fav. Otherwise the meal was good. Got super busy at noon, so be prepared to wait if you don't get there a little earlier.
author: Sue J.

description:
Best burger in San Francisco. That is a bold claim, not that San Francisco is especially well known for great burgers, but there are a lot of great restaurants, and a lot of them put burgers on the menu. But unless all the dubious friends I have brought here are all sycophants, it has been established that Louie's does in fact have the best burger in the city.

I've tried several other things on the menu, and none of them disappoint either. In particular, the fried chicken sandwich is incredibly savory. Usually, however, the opportunity cost of not having the burger is too great to venture into the rest of the menu. If you are ever feeling adventurous, try the burger with everything: avocado, bacon, cheese, and an egg for only $19. Personally I've never been so bold, but I have heard great things about it. I'd also recommend upgrading to the sweet potato fries, which come with a side of spicy ketchup.

Their service is also usually pretty great. Despite their being swamped during lunch and dinner during the weekdays, their waitresses still remember regulars after a few visits.

I will continue to search the city for a better burger, but I am doubtful there is one to be found.
author: Michael S.

description: The lady who runs this place is incredibly rude - a laughable attempt at customer service....avoid at all costs.
author: James P.

description: GO GET THIS BURGER and thank me later!!! Came here during the lunch rush but the wait was only 10 minutes for a table of 3. Plenty of seats at the bar but we wanted to chat. Really good selection of beer on tap but I was nursing a hangover so it was ginger beer for me. This burger is amazing- bacon jam, melty mouth goodness. I added white cheddar to take it to the next level, and was melt with a flavor explosion. Even the fries are amazing- bonus that they're thick so you can mop up your plate- which we totally did. Oh Louie's, you've won a new fan!
author: Alyssa J.

description: Back again in 2017. Same great bar, different people, different menu. No more cheesesteak, but burger was quite good.
author: Alton Y.

description:
Awesome spot for happy hour and dinner. I can step here and definitely kill two birds with one stone. The beer selection is solid the food is amazing. 

Food tried:
Burger add fried egg and bacon
Fried pork sando
Loaded fries
Garlic fries

It's a cool joint because it's always pretty busy during happy hour and if you want to be around people and not worry about good food and drink this is the spot.
