The only thing that doesn't make this five stars for me is the two tvs. It's awesome they show Classic movies, but when one wants to catch the football or basketball game, "the satellite is non functioning." Maybe that's their crowd control. Regardless, the staff is superb no matter what and I'll have no hesitations coming here after work or bringing friends here at any time.
author: Rafael R.

description: Dive bar that we somehow ended up in after super bowl city. It was packed that night. The atmosphere is really chill and friendly. Service was a tad slow but they were soooo busy that night so I completely understand. Somebody had the wifi password and was airplaying videos to the tv's which was hilarious. I would def come back here again!
author: Lisa D.

description: Solid dive bar in FiDi! I came here with friends on a Friday night, it was definitely busy but we didn't have to wait to be seated for drinks/appetizers/dinner. For food, I'd recommend the Tempest egg sandwich (breakfast foods are always appropriate IMO). My friend was a fan of the potato skins as well. I wouldn't go out of my way to go here but it's a solid choice for when you're in the neighborhood (aka after work).
author: Connie Q.

description:
I think I've found my go-to bar!

The great selection (thanks bartenders for the suggestions!) and the atmosphere were enough to win me over.  The nice exposed brick walls (sorry this is a little hipster-y), the lively mood and the great popcorn makes this a definite place to go.  I can't emphasize how good the popcorn was: the beer(s) might have played a part in elevating the flavor, but it definitely good even without being inebriated.

Come here if you're in the heart of SF and want to have a great night!

(I know I've mentioned this already but, the servers ARE AWESOME: this is already enough of a reason to be a repeat customer for this place!)
author: Kevin L.

description:
I guess my dad was recommended to come here from a bar in the area that doesn't serve food while he was in town for a conference. He then led us here during our wedding weekend celebrations one of the nights before the wedding to get dinner with some out of town friends. We got there at about 8pm on a Thursday night and it was PACKED. This is not a big place - it almost seems like an alley between some buildings that was closed in to make another space, but there was a football game on TV that led to it being incredibly crowded and loud. I was shocked that THIS was where dad picked to take us with some friends we hadn't seen in years. Turns out, when they were there before, it was NOT football season, and there were MAYBE 3 other sets of people in the place. My dad's gf said they never would have brought us there that night had they realized how crowded it could be!

Well I'm glad we went anyway - we ended up managing to snag enough tables as the game wound down, we eventually had 10 people total in our group. We ordered drinks plus a selection of food to all share: Tacos, burgers, loaded fries (omg yum!), RANCH POPCORN (my new favorite snack!), and maybe some other things. All the food was great, everyone got their fill, and everyone had a good time. We will definitely try to come again when we're back in the city.
author: Amanda M.

description:
This place sucks! Loud, TV on sling box is terrible... And the servers are incompetent (except Cindy she rocks!)
Won't be back this year.
author: pierre p.

description: Danger: you can walk in at lunch, have some donks and before you know it the HH crowd is flowing in.  A great spot flat-out!  Cindy is amazing, so friendly and welcoming!  Food is well priced and served promptly -it doesn't sit around under some heat lamp.  And please, don't be that guy (or gal) who rocks a backpack in a full bar, this place can get pretty packed.
author: M K.

description:
Solid four-star afterwork option for beer and food.  No clue why people classify this place as a dive-bar...maybe if you're used to a country club...anyway...

Pretty much echoing other reviews here.  The food is delicious with a great beer selection.  Service was excellent but they can get busy.

Great place for afterwork. Looking forward to coming back.
author: Zoran L.

description: The food is surprisingly delicious, some of the best lunch in the area. The beer selection is great, the staff is super sweet. I love it here. Just don't plan to waltz in at 1pm on a Thursday and get a table. It's pretty popular despite being kind of hidden.
author: Geoff G.

description: Love this hidden dive bar in the FIDI. Perfect place to get a beer after work and their potato skins are super good. It gets really packed around 6pm on the weekdays but the bartender is super attentive and awesome!
author: Katie P.

description:
I used to love Louie's as it's always been our university pub for GGU.

However, in the recent months the bar has become increasingly packed and it's essentially impossible to get a seat around happy hour. I've given up going here because it's too hectic and busy for a chill time.
author: Nina M.

description:
Great lunch spot.  Small menu, but every item is well crafted.

The burger is one of the best in the city - especially for the price.  The Bacon Jam on it is a fantastic touch.

The Reuben is another solid choice, as is the Steak and Egg sandwich.

For appetizers, the Mussels are a surprise as well - way better than a lot of actual seafood restaurants in SF and very unique.


And, of course, the beers are great (can't review a bar without talking about the beer!)  They usually have a good sour beer that will change out frequently and a solid stout.
author: Cody C.

description:
Louie's brick walls, beer selection and tasty bar food (sweet potato fries) keep me coming back.  The place is LOUD with all of its popularity I have to say, but there's some good people watching and the bartenders are much kinder than many under such pressure.  (Rob takes care of you) Mostly professionals.

Two restrooms, close to BART, well-lit area, safe atmosphere.  Good SF vibe.
author: Julie W.

description: I just met up with my friend for happy hour and got the burger which was AMAZING! The meat wad flavorful and cooked to perfection but my only complaint is that the egg (extra) was not over easy or Sunnyside up... I love it when the yolk is dripping down the patty in every promiscuous way possible but the yolk was unfortunately cooked 75% and nothing sexy about it.  They have a great beer & liquor selection so I definitely appreciated that.  It can get quite loud so if you're looking to catchup with your friend and have a pinky up cocktail, this may not be the place for you but if you are looking to get down and dirty with a burger, please go! :)
author: Jasmine C.

description: The food lived up to the hype. My friend and I just got out of class and were looking for a place still open (it was past 9:00pm). She was scared about it being a bar but the menu looked good and the reviews were great. Thank God she listened to me. I loved the summer chicken sando and the house salad. She loved her artichokes and sweet potato fries. The service is attentive. She refilled our drinks and answered our questions. Definitely worth going back.
author: April G.

description: Down an alley, partially under construction at the time of this post, is a great find. A local hangout with a good late night menu, fun bartenders, and a killer beer and cocktail list. It's divey, but not dirty. It's casual and comfortable.
author: Jessica D.

description: Great music, amazing selection of liquor, mouth watering food, and awesome beers on tap. This place is nicely tucked away with a welcoming ambiance. Definitely new favorite place. Also very easy to get to with great prices!
author: Jason C.

description:
Focus on the positive, Dave. You can do it. 

Ok, so service was with a smile, fast, and friendly. They were all sorts of congenial and honest. 

The honest part is hard when you have to tell someone that you don't have what they're in love with on the menu. 

My heart was broken three times. This is probably more a testament to my tendency to get into far too emotional of relationships with descriptions of food on menus, and really something I'll need to work through with my therapist. 

I mean, try starting a serious relationship with a kale salad and then having it all whisked away by the words "We don't have that." I mean, I had a small house and kids in mind already, am I moving too fast? Maybe that's it. It's not you, it's me. Me and my kale house. 

But honestly, the point at which it was truly heartbreaking was when essentially the drink that fit my bill (it had ginger and whiskey and something else that made it absolutely perfect) and the dish that made me super happy (anything with sweet potatoes... an-y-thing) were both out. That should have been the three strikes rule but it was Monday in the SoMa and that's apparently like going out for a breath of fresh ocean air in the middle of the desert. That oasis? An illusion, buck up, man. Buck up. 

So the dishes I went with were great, big pile of greasy fries, fantastic little salad with grapes and something else, maybe. Who knows, my heart was broken. I didn't care anymore. I was busy filing divorce papers from the place in my mind the rest of the meal. The drink specials were go... eh.  

Come on, you can make it through this. You can DO IT. 

But seriously, the drinks were well balanced, the drink specials were varietal. Shots and a beer selections were on point, with something for just about everyone, except for those people giving up beer. Or shots. Or shots and beer. 

Would I go again? Of course. I'd love to give them a second shot, especially if they have any of their primary items I like in stock.
author: David C.

description:
Louie's Bar is an interesting place that has good food. It's not your typical "bar food". The entrance is in an alley so it doesn't get a lot of people walking around, but it gets pretty crowded in here during lunch time. If you're going with a large group, it's best to get here before the lunch hour starts.

== Food ==

Medium rare burger with cheese and bacon. The beef was nicely cooked and was still juicy. Beef juicy dripped off the bun with each bite into the burger. Delicious burger overall.

== Service ==

I sat at the bar counter and got good service. Food took a bit of time to come out, but it's expected of a sit down place.

== Overall ==

It's a great hidden gem type of place to go grab lunch. They make a great burger. I heard the other menu items are good too.
author: Steven B.

description:
One of the best places in Downtown
Friendly people, good food and drinks. If you like Mexican food get the Chicken Pibil Taco (3) big tacos for only $12. 
Everything is good here
author: Danny H.

description: Loved this place. Great selection of whiskey and interesting wings. We came in really late looking for some grub after seeing Green Day at the Oracle Arena and found this place on Yelp while on the BART. :) I wish I knew the name of the bartender because I would call her out for being great too. I will definitely hit this spot again for late night or just to hang out.
author: Debra R.

description: If you're okay with loud/small bars, then I recommend coming here to eat and drink! The food is gooooooooooood. I enjoyed the potato skins and loaded fries. Both of them are a lot of potato so get one or the other! Hard to get a table if you come after work so you'll probably be standing...
author: Annie S.

description:
Nice place to go for lunch.  The food menu is limited, but what I got was pretty good.  Drink selection is fantastic and the cider on tap was good too.

I wouldn't call this a "Dive Bar" as it's much nicer than what I consider what a "Dive Bar" to be.  But it is a nice place for those of you that work in the FiDi like me and want an unassuming place to just relax during lunch and maybe sneak in a beer before going back to the office.

I'd be interested in seeing how the place is for dinner...but that is another Yelp Review.
author: Edward M.

description:
Louie's Bar is a cool little watering hole, but it's in an off-putting area, in an alley in between 1st and 2nd Street. Had I been alone, I wouldn't have wanted to trek here all by my lonesome. Granted, I am a broad-shouldered, nearly 6 foot tall woman, but my parents instilled in me the sort of paranoia that characters in horror movies clearly don't have. 

I would hate to run into some dark and shadowy figure just to get my drink on, so I would advise other ladies to make sure you have an escort if you are coming here. The FiDi seems pretty empty late at night, but still... you never know. 

They have a pretty good shot and a beer deal (pint of Miller High Life + a shot of Bulleitt bourbon for 8 bux), but the food is pretty much a complete flop, at least when it comes to vegan options. It is kinda cool that they serve food until 1am, so your drunk ass doesn't have to go all the way to the Mission for a burrito. 

I ordered the Falafel Wrap (without tzatziki sauce and without feta). They put the cheese in it anyway, gahhhhh! ::insert string of expletives here::

I really need to start being more aggressive about this and maybe even saying that I have a severe dairy allergy, since many restaurants do not take it seriously. I think I do have a slight allergy, in that I get really congested and my stomach gets queasy and angry, but maybe that's just lactose intolerance? Even so, renegade cheese DOES NOT belong in my falafel wrap. It seemed really small, but it does come with a side of fries or salad.  

My friend ordered the Sweet Potato Tacos (with no crema) and I wasn't impressed. Beyond bland, no seasoning at all, and the taters were way undercooked. 

I suppose that living in San Francisco, one of the food meccas in the country, has turned me into some snobby c*nt who turns up her nose at everything, but I'm just being honest. After all, honesty is the best policy. 

Probably not my kinda place, but you omnivores might dig it. I will stick to Benders and The Flying Falafel.
author: Brandi W.

description:
Drunchies were hitting my group hard Saturday night and we all ended up here drawn by the fact that the kitchen doesn't close until 1AM. 

It's kind of off to it's own on Stevenson and the crowd is a lot more laid back and I'll be honest, my group didn't totally fit in. They were playing all the classic rock you want to hear, whether or not you know the lyrics (bartender made the comment " If you're gonna sing it sing it right!".

Drink selection and specials are what I enjoyed the most. Food was aiight, maybe I wasn't drunk enough?  Chicharones were my favorite out of what everyone got. My friend was pretty underwhelmed by her baked potato fries thing. \

Oh, and they were playing the Omen, which was kind of fun to have going in the background.
author: Jillian S.

description:
Sorry, not a fan!

The good:

-Potato Skins
-Cocktails are pretty tasty

The bad:
-Servers are seriously pushy. We had a standing table and they would come up to us every 10 minutes to clear our plates and collect the bills. Maybe this is their way of being efficient or something but they would butt in on conversations to grab stuff and ask if we were still working on our food every 5 minutes even though we already said we were still working on it. Sheesh! They would also touch us everytime they walked past us which I didn't like. This may be to prevent spills or something but there was clearly enough room to get around us without grabbing our backs every time.
-Cramped. You'll have to move every time someone has to go to the bathroom. Its like sardines in there 
-No happy hour specials really...and pretty pricey
- They played the Warriors game on the two TVs they had but it was a stream from a computer and they left the computer mouse on the screen the whole time!

Eh, not an ideal place to watch a game. We came a little after 5 for a 6:00 warriors game and got the last standing table. I mean if you came early and got a seat I guess it would be a little better but the service for me was very pushy and rude so I won't be back.
author: Jenann P.

description:
Had lunch here earlier today with a friend. Ate the spinach salad with burrata cheese and it was delicious but I've been throwing up for the past hour now??? 

Update: next day. I shouldn't have ordered the salad. My friend got the grilled cheese and feels fine. I'm still nauseous...
author: Krista E.

description: The best bar in San Francisco!!!! Was amazingly surprised by the custom cuisine and incredible service! We will be back every time we're in the city!
author: Kelli M.

description:
SEXY EVERYTHING!

bartenders are sexy and amazing... (they can make a mean cocktail served up with a smile and they always remember their customers)

servers are sexy and amazing, plus pretty freakin awesome ^~^ (especially considering how busy it can be around lunch and after work)

FOOD IS AMAZING! extra props there, even if you don't drink, their food is definitely worth checking out. It's like barfood and a michelin star restaurant had a baby.
Guarantee you can order anything on the menu and it will taste delicious, also they keep it changing which is nice. Ingredients are always fresh. 
The burger is hands down the best burger in the city.
(plus they keep the kitchen open till 1am; an impossible find in that neighborhood)


Bottom Line..... Louie's is the perfect place to go and get a drink + food for a good price with great service even late night.
author: katie s.

description: Oh Louie's...I wouldn't have gotten through law school without you! Great food, great beer, great atmosphere! This place is definitely one of a kind. Great for lunch and dinner. It's been getting packed these days so be sure to reserve a table!
author: Irina M.

description:
I've been in San Francisco for 3 weeks, moved here with a job and this place is pretty close.

I now live in this bar, the staff are friendly and attentive, the food is bloody superb and the drinks on offer are great.

Anyone coming to the city should hit this place up, lunch or dinner.
author: Will R.

description:
I was surprised by how classy of a dive bar this was. In fact, is it even a dive bar or just paying homage to dive bars? It's San Francisco, so probably the latter...

 It was a very pleasant atmosphere, great and varied menu of bar food - with a twist, and a nice selection of draft. I really enjoyed the drafts that mixed in wine flavors with them - very interesting, light flavor and their vinegar fries were so good, I could've eaten the whole plate by myself. We also tried the buffalo wings, which were just alright, and we think the bangkok ones looked way better.

Prices don't reflect a dive bar, but are reasonable for downtown SF. Seating is kind of limited, but, while it is crowded for happy hour, it's not crazy packed inside. The time we went it was reallly loud though, which is why I knocked the one star. They were blasting club-time music even though it was 6 PM on a Tuesday.
author: Christina R.

description:
I finally - FINALLY - got to try this place earlier this week.  Lunch on a Wednesday.  Very nice staff, adorable little neighborhood bar.  All the other times I've tried to check this place out, it's been either WAY too crowded, or closed.  I hear they will be open limited hours on weekends soon.  That's good for those of us stuck working in the financial district on weekends.  

I love the layout of this bar, the brick walls.  I wish there was a bar like this in my sleepy SoCal hometown.  I hope I get to visit this place again before my assignment here in San Fran is over.

Cheers!
author: Cindi R.

description:
Awesome place to go to with a great selection of beer and liquor food is also delicious ! 
Has something for meaty eaters and all you grass eaters ;)
author: Brian N.

description: This place is great, if you can get a seat! It's super busy and both times I've come I've almost walked out because it was so packed. The second time I got lucky and got a seat at the bar, where I enjoyed $5 highballs and a delicious bowl of spicy popcorn.
author: Delilah B.

description:
Small. Intimate. Loud. And almost elbow-to-elbow, but not quite. 

Louie's Bar is the place you hang out in your mid to late 20s. It's the place you go to to feel like you're a little more sophisticated and don't just go to dive bars. It's that hole-in-the-wall off the side street that you would never notice unless you intentionally looked for it or walked down the back alleys of Stevenson on a daily basis. 

For those who like something to munch on while they're at the bar, Louie's serves much more than your ordinary American bar food and puts a fancy twist on things. Definitely recommend the chicken wings (not the buffalo wings) and getting some potato skins to share. 

Carb lovers unite! 

However, if you're looking for a nice stout or a wide variety of dark beers, best to look elsewhere.
author: Rebecca H.

description: Go out of your way to come here! The food is amazing. Definitely a diamond in the rough. The shishito peppers and the Pozole are to die for. Do it, you won't be sorry!!!
author: Judie A.

description: Vibe is cool and drinks are of decent pricing, but noise level is completely UNcontrollable!!!!!  I'd suggest installing some sound boards to diffuse or reduce the noise level, PLEASEEEEEE.  Seriously, it is almost unbearable even though I understand we were at a bar!!  I ran into two other ladies in the restroom and they all said the exact same thing!!!  One of the ladies actually urged me to mention this on my Yelp review, which I had planned on doing so anyways.  Hopefully the owner would consider doing something about the deafening noise.  Other than that, I have no complaints, a fun and hipster place to hang after work.
author: Vicky H.

description: The food is consistently good here. Even if you're not looking to grab a drink, I would recommend going here just for the burger. I've been to quite a few burger places that somehow make a mediocre or bad burger. Louie's puts those burger places to shame.
author: John D.

description:
I never get to this part of town, but was recently brought here by a buddy who works in the area and was surprised with what I found.  Great beer list, decent prices for the area, and the food that I saw come out of the kitchen looked pretty great.  Bartenders were friendly and responsive as well.  A Bulleit and a pint of High Life will set you back $8, which is pretty close to the Sunset district prices I'm used to.  

Long story short, if I had the misfortune of having to work downtown every day, I could definitely see myself stopping off here for a drink on the way home.
author: Joshua W.

description:
Discovered this bar while working downtown. Fortunate cause their potato skin with pork belly topped with a quail egg. Shit is crackin. Did not care for the fish sliders, and it really was my fault to get a draft Blue Moon cause I was too picky to choose something else. 

Crowded seating when packed, but overall a cool atmosphere and crowd. Bathroom sucks. Decent pricing.
author: C M.

description:
Nice bar for happy hour and lite dinner though the drink selection for happy hour is sort of limited (only one cocktail). I had the Paloma which was good if a bit weak. Lots of beers on the menu. 

The food was better than expected. Great beef tacos and sweet potato fries. More substantial and interesting bar food than typical places.

Location is FiDi but the crowd is techie/casual. Not a lot of suits and ties. They show games here too on a couple big screens. You can sit at the bar but there are tables too. Waiter was nice but it was hard to hear her... 

Beware the noise level. It is LOUD! You really have to yell to have a conversation. Not a good place for a date or to catch up w/ friends. I'll be back if I'm in the area after work (pretty central location and easy to get to on Muni/Bart).
author: Semuteh F.

description: End of a long drive from Bend, Oregon and came into get some bits with a beverage and it was awesome! Sweet Lou's Bangkok Wings where great. A must stop for out of towner's.
author: Gabriel S.

description:
A colleague and friend has been raving about Louie's burger for awhile now. We put time on the calendar to go this week. Unfortunately, I was feeling the strong desire to eat healthy so I ordered the Panzanella Salad. It was super delicious! Everything was fresh, from the burratta cheese to the tomatoes and the squash blossoms. I ordered it with chicken which was cooked and seasoned perfectly. I had a bite of the burger that my friend ordered which was INSANE. SO delicious. I will definitely be getting my next burger splurge here. 

I had such a great meal that I went the very next day with another colleague who ordered the Grilled Cheese (again, amazing served with Burratta cheese) and a side of sweet potatoes (seasoned and cooked nicely). I think this is now my go-to lunch joint.
author: Courtney D.

description:
I work downtown, but was looking for something close, but different from the usual I've been eating at lunch. Louie's Bar is close to me, but I'd never gone in. Now I wish I'd gone earlier.
I had the medium rare burger, which was closer to rare than medium, but that was ok with me. Really good! and too big to finish. It was decked out with crispy strings of onion or potato - not sure which, arugula and a sauce that looked more like marinara than secret sauce. Mellow and tasty. It came with fries for $12.00. I was not disappointed.
I also ordered the fried olives. I've been hunting for the cook who made them at the Washington Square Bar & Grill, but have yet to find them. These were good, but still had pits in. The fried sage and other herbs were a real plus.
I'd love to go back in the evening when I can have a drink and sample the menu some more. There was a grilled pimento cheese and tomato sandwich that I want to try - other things, too. The menu seems to rotate a few things in and out. I like that.
The service was very friendly and helpful.
I'll definitely go back.
author: Marty R.

description:
If it were just Cindy behind the bar I would give this an awesome 5 star.
Been coming here for almost 8 years for strong drinks and great beers.
The new - ish bartenders are as welcome as the crowd. Super abrasive and almost as loud.
The one guy in particular his name must be Rick. Always treats me like a ... new patron.

Alright enough with the rhyming.

Love the new menus. The food is really really good. Can't say enough about Cindy and the rest of the ladies. Wish you could clone her and get rid of the shadies. 

Sorry couldn't stop rhyming. Drink and eat here and beg them to get A/C.
author: Warren D.

description: Good dive bar with a nice beer list. This is a good stop if you are in SOMA. I would want to eat here, but I haven't yet. The beer and food seem to be priced better than most options in the area.
author: Jonah K.

description: We are in town from Seattle to catch a Giants game. Starving afterwards, we set out to find some late night food. Through a recommendation and Yelp, we stumbled in here and ordered burgers. It may have been the previously consumed beer, but honestly, in the moment, I swear they were the best burgers we've ever eaten!  You won't be disappointed.
author: Diane U.

description: If you want a cheap drink and a place with shitty food, don't come here. Their specials are amazing and if you are in the industry.  the fooooooood is fucking savage.  If you aren't used to food inbred city..... You might hate the place. But for my bra's of wherever .......! Come visit
author: Chris H.

description: Nothing really stood out but we got here and took a seat at the bar, ordered a round of drink and some fries to snack on. This was the first stop on a night checking out bar in our new neighborhood, I'm sure we'd go back again but probably not for a while. So many other places just stood out to us that we'd go to first plus places we hadn't been to before.
author: Sarah S.

description: The waitresses were very good at making sure the table was cleared out of dishes however, at the end I wasn't too pleased with the service. There was one waitress that was more interested in flirting and sitting in one guys lap than helping anyone. I looked around the bar and I wasn't the only one watching her and wondering what the heck was going on and if they were going to get service. I waited 10 minutes for our check that I asked for twice now and her response was, "Oh did no one bring it?" and I'm like "umm you're the ONLY waitress working so...no". Only good part was that I really enjoyed the wings. The wings is what really got me. Unfortunately, the burger wasn't good at all, and the fries were underwhelming. Don't think I would go again.
author: Heather S.

description: Solid dive bar for a good drink and good service! It is on a small street tucked away from the main streets but easily accessible. The shrimp po'boy is a must.
author: Morris C.

description: They've slightly changed their lunch menu.  I tried their shrimp po boy sandwich and it was AMAZING!!!!.. it had bacon, a corn claw, and lettuce on a toasted roll. Service was quick and friendly.  We arrived before the lunch rush.
author: rachelle w.

description:
Went here for lunch. It was crowded but we were able to get the 3 of us on the chef's bar in the back. 

We ordered some of the saucy wings. I can't remember the name. They were delicious. 

I had the Chicken Bahn mi sandwich. It was very tasty. 

Service was prompt, courteous and attentive. I plan to go back here for sure. 

Also, very affordable. Great job folks.
author: Mack L.

description: Came here around 7ish on a Saturday night. The bartender was quick to come over and greet us. I ordered my first Fernet and coke.  I usually drink Fernet neat and he made it perfect in my book.  I can't really compare LOL but it was refreshing and tasty.  My sweets ordered the cheeseburger and in the words of my sweets the fries were the Bomb! I did get to try a couple before he devoured them and I would agree they were seasoned great and cooked perfect.  I was kind of depressed I didn't get more hahaha.  I guess I was too into my curry mussels and buffalo wings.  The mussels were ok.  The curry took over and I could not really enjoy the flavor of the mussels.  The sauce on the wings was delish and different but sadly the wings themselves did not seem fresh to me.  It seemed like they may have been frozen too long.  I'm so sorry to say I disliked the potato skins and that is what I was most looking forward to.  Sooooooooo sooooooo salty. Yuck!  They were edible but it was like licking a salt block.  If you are looking for a relaxed bar with a fun pub grub menu this place fits the bill. Cheers!
author: Shauna L.

description:
First things first-Yelp classifies this as a dive bar? REALLY? Everyone in here is a wearing button down shirts and dress pants. It's not a dive bar. 

That aside, this is rapidly becoming one of my favorite places to escape for a quick drink when I can sneak away from a long shift at work for a moment.  I haven't even tried the food, but it smells good. The beer selection is all I need to keep me satisfied. The prices are pretty reasonable for the neighborhood and it's hidden enough away that the boss will never find me!
author: Steve A.

description:
I've been here a few times in the last month because it's conveniently close to my new office.  A little too close perhaps!

Have come here for boozy lunches, and it was a surprising find.  I've always thought of anything SOMA as being without a soul or personality and Louie's is anything but.  Really wonderful staff make you feel welcome.  The menu is filled with creative infusions to classic bar food, which makes it upscale.

Beer menu looks ok, but I can personally vouch for the Manhattans, my current cocktail of choice.
author: Amy Z.

description: This place was recommended by the Concierge at a hotel we were staying at. Came here on Sunday evening to grab some grub. This place is a little divey and we love it!! We sat at the bar and our bartender was friendly and knowledgeable! We started off with the potato skins; a must have at this place! Yummy pork belly and a quail egg topped with crema; so fricken good! We also got the Tempest; omg another must try; fried egg, arugula, yellow cheddar, serrano ham, whole grain balsamic mustard on an english muffin! Def coming back to sample more of there menu! The drinks are good and we totally enjoyed this place.
author: R. B.

description:
A neighborhood bar in the middle of Fi-di, love it.  It gets pretty busy during lunchtime during the week and yet I've never seen the staff get stressed.  They are so friendly and help you feel super welcome.

The lunch menu is awesome and I love their selection of beers on tap.  I came here for a few World Cup matches and had a ton of fun.
author: Jonathan C.

description:
Bartender didn't know how to make the drink that I asked for, but not only that, was a bitch about it.

Food was alright but overpriced.  $10 for a Denny's hamburger, $6 for just french fries.

It was pretty crowded around 5pm on a Tuesday, but I can't see why.
author: Carlin F.

description: I had a training class at Golden Gate University for a few days last week, and by Friday, we were wiped out and wanted to finish off the week strong. This bar is no more than a 3-4 minute walk from the campus, so off to Louie's we went. It had the Happy Hour I desired (High Life drafts for $3 all night I think, Bud Light bottles also $3 from 4-6). That's all I needed to hear. They have some different food specials as well, but I didn't really partake in them. I had some buffalo wings that looked fairly artisan, but were tasty. The bar around 4pm is packed to the gills and there's very little ventilation, forcing you to feel like you are sitting in a sauna. There's a decent amount of seating, both with high tables sans chairs and booths, but the bar is really narrow, so it's tough to find a spot. Luckily, we were able to commandeer a booth in the back for our moderately large group (small tables can be pushed together to create one larger table for assistance). Servers are fast and attentive, and really friendly. I always appreciate a good banter with the people doing all of the heavy lifting. They have TV's overhead for sports watching too. Overall, solid spot in FiDi to blow off some steam and not break the bank at. Just wear a short sleeve shirt and bring a paper fan, if possible.
author: Dan M.

description:
Went there for lunch today around 1pm - there was a line, but it went pretty quickly. My friend and I each ordered a drink first - mine was super strong on the alcohol (we later found out hers was, too, but it didn't have the taste of alcohol). The sweet potato fries appetizer was huge and delicious! Could've been its own meal, actually. I had the falafel wrap and it was pretty good, too (not the best, but I'm a falafel fiend). 
Overall, nice atmosphere, lots of drink choices (beer, wine, and cocktails), and good food. I'll go back, for sure!
author: Melissa Y.

description: Great spot for lunch. There's a long wait. Nice small menu. Yummy food. My burger was automatically cooked medium rare, which I appreciate. I also appreciated the substituted-for-fries salad. Wished they had regular bbq sauce.
author: Andrew K.

description:
4 Stars for:
- Serving Food until 1am even on a weeknight in the FiDi San Francisco!
- Being close to the BART
- Food was really good 
- Get Drunk for Cheap Specials 
- Top notch service

Alright so it was 11pm and I'm hungry. I had just gone to Nightlife at the Cal Academy. Had a few drinks but was resisting the $11 drink prices all night. I was on the M line heading downtown looking on Yelp for places that were open late and more than 2 stars. Finally I gave up, went to Google and found a 7x7 Article on late night food in San Francisco. I immediately began cross comparing the Yelp reviews to the website article. Luckily it didn't take long to find something open late, downtown, with good reviews.

It was a little tricky finding the place (if you see the Shields place you have gone to far; it is beside some Japanese place). Walk in scan the menu and order the burger and a drink special. 

The Drink Special is on all the time. You get a shot of Bullet Bourbon and a beer for $8. I asked the server if i could get it on the rocks, and to my delight I was brought 2oz of premium Bullet Bourbon and the beer. I should clarify I know my bartender skills; that really was 2 full oz; no club shots here! So it was awesome. I drank up the bourbon sipping slowly, the food came and I ate my burger with it. Man did it hit me hard. For $8 I was instantly feeling it; I've spent $60 at other places for the same result. So needless to say it made for a great night and made the BART all that more enjoyable!

Now the food is what really shocked me. For late night food I was not expecting much. The burger though was amazing! It was the type of burger that is ground chuck, cooked medium rare bloody as hell. It was amazing. 

Lastly service was excellent, and I was given the check and my card ran really quick so I could run to catch the last BART.

Next time I want some cheap drinks and late night eats I am heading there!
author: Chris S.

description: Great atmosphere! I came here to watch a Warriors game after work, and I must say, this place did not disappoint. I ordered a Hef and The Burger. Both were delicious! My coworker and I were served as soon as we sat down. They have big screen TVs that are perfect for watching any sporting event, as well as an intimate atmosphere. Good food, good beer, good service! I will be back!
author: Madisen B.

description:
Food: awesome
Bartenders: friendly and hella cool (damn straight I said hella)
Atmosphere: chill and fun
author: Devynne H.

description:
Great local bar with a good cocktail 
Iist and nice staff. Food is good too. One of my favorites in the city
author: Howard C.

description: Why this place isn't 5 stars is beyond me. The location is awesome, the interior is awesome, staff is awesome as well. The food is great, and the alcohol/ beer selection is huge. Prices are much more reasonable than typical SF prices.
author: Christopher G.

description:
Great bar food with perfect small bar ambiance! It is small but well lit and clean. Not a dive by any stretch but prices are great! $5-6 for a beer which felt good. Derive awash good but not bothersome.

Watched the World Cup semi finals and it was a fun atmosphere but not too crazy. They are showing the games via a laptop which makes the feed a bit spotty. Wouldn't be okay watching too many games here, actually if they can't fix that wouldn't recommend it. Worth checking in though because otherwise it's perfect. 

(Update: the TV did get better at half. The manager responded and let me know that due to the age of the building they struggle with reception but also good to see that they were on top of trying to get the best reception throughout the game.$
author: Kate W.

description: This place is absolutely fab! Paid a visit to Bare ESCENTUALS HQ next door and stopped in for Lunch.  One of the oldest bars in San Francisco, the dark wood furniture and exposed brick walls created a create ambiance.  The place was busy as hell with sexy wait staff and cool dudes all busying around providing great service.  I dived into a micro brew and a Lamb Gyro with Fries, there was a cool menu though with lots to choose.  Awesome! Nuff said! You have to go!
author: Nick O.

description:
It's a great spot for happy hour.  Now that they remodeled they are much busier then before.

Review from the happy hour menu 4-6:
Food: Awesome!  
We ordered the chili fries, garlic fries, bone marrow fritters, and spicy chicken wings/
Drinks: good selection
Service: We were a big party and our server was on it.

I would recommend that you stop by here after work if your looking for a place to unwind.
author: R C.

description:
Finding a bite after 10 in the city is TOUGH. Fortunately, my BF and I stumbled upon this place after walking back from AT&T to our hotel. 
Not only were they still serving food around 11, it was awesome! Pastrami sandwich was delicious. The sweet potato fries were incredible. The asian sweet buffalo wings also to die for. Beer selection met my snobby craft beer needs. Ambiance was chill and our server was spot on. Next time I'm out there, we will def hit up this place for a late night bite!
author: Liv J.

description: Louie's bar is a staple at my current company. Lunch their is always a go-to and grabbing a few drinks at happy hour is a regular occurrence. Two words: donkey-show. Best combination and most reasonably priced drink for blocks. A bottle of Pacifico and a shot of tequila would be a great start for almost anyone looking for a proper night out in the city.  I recommend Louie's to my friends and anyone reading.
author: Edgar E.

description:
I absolutely love this bar!

I was invited to a coworkers going away party and it was the first time I had heard or been to this bar. I was pleasantly surprised to find this cute gem of a dive bar within the concrete financial jungle of Downtown San Francisco. It has a pleasant decor for a 'dive' bar and the vibe is super chill and inviting. It was easy to hang out, conversate and drink. The shot and beer combo they have on special did me just right, just like the prices.

Also, the food is AMAZING. I was happier than a bird with a french fry when they told me food was served till 1AM. It's seriously is one of the best late night bar food spots in the City.

Overall a great experience, not too crowded (though I was only there 'early' on a Thursday night, might be different on other days), great food, music and drinks.

I would give it 5 stars, but my only gripe was that it took a little while than it needed to get attention from the girl bartender to get a drink at a pretty empty bartop. 

Cheers!
author: Casey A.

description: Definitely one of the best burgers in the city. One of my go to spots for lunch during the work week to be able to sit and have a conversation. The food is great, the owners are super nice and the menu changes with what's in season. Love this place!
author: Gwen R.

description:
Came here for lunch with a client. The fish sando was AMAZING. It was super lightly fried and the French roll it was on was soft. They have their fish sent in daily, so it is really fresh. Which is probably why they can cook it the way they do and not have it over breaded and over fried.

The ambiance was very nice.the exposed brick wall have it some personality. 

They even have li hing sauce on heirloom tomatoes for all you Hawaiian culture fanatics. 

I am planning to come here for lunch more often and try more things on the menu. 

TVs- check
Full bar- check
Attentive staff- check
Good food- check
Affordable food- check

I'm so happy I found this gem in an alley I'd never think it'd be.
author: Elisa T.

description:
I like Tempest better. Maybe it's because I went there first but Louie's Bar is pretty solid as well. The food is great. 

What we tried:
Burger - really tasty. Different from the Box burger at Tempest but just as good.
Chicken wings - these were alright. I didn't love them.
Fully loaded fries - really yummy...sour cream, bacon, cheese on crispy fries..how can you go wrong with that? 

Atmosphere is a little more "upscale". Nicer local. Friendly staff. I'd come here again.
author: Jessica L.

description:
Awesome bar food right next to my office? Of course I'm giving this place 5 stars :)

Seriously, came here for lunch and was pleasantly surprised that their bar food was a decent lunch. Nothing was too greasy. 

I had the hot pastrami and it was delish. I enjoyed the hint of the horseradish spread on my sandwich. Also the fries are super crispy and soo addictive.

Great place for drinks and good grub!
author: Christine W.

description: Recommended by the server at another restaurant when asked if they had burgers. She said it's where she went after work . She was right. The burger was really good and the Ranch popcorn and sweet potato fries were on point as well. I don't love all the shi-shi pooh poo food ( and horrible service) of the SF but I must say this one was simple hidden hole in the wall that delivered.
author: Erica N.

description: What a great find - though its been around forever.  Drinks are good, food is great and the atmosphere is cozy!
author: S. Pat R.

description:
Love Louie's for late night. It's a good local spot, food is served til 1am and it's some of the best (and definitely best late night) bar food in the city. The classic drink specials rolling from tempest are perfect for a quick hit and run. Beers on draught seem like what's a rotation and the selection isn't bad. Something for everybody. Haven't tried a whole lot of the cocktails but from what the board reads they sound pretty good. 

The main thing I'm stoked on Louie's right now is because they've recently opened on weekends, which again is good for a local establishment especially in soma and close the to FiDi. 

I highly recommend for a drink and bite with friends.  

Note for discretion that it gets jam packed for happy hour during the week!
author: Raymond Michael S.

description: Great food, friendly people, and awesome employees. My go-to spot.
author: Sariya A.

description:
Kitchen is Open Late
Chill
Bar
Small
Not scene'y
author: Charliena B.

description:
Whoa whoa whoa! I've been to Louie's several times before- usually just for the happy hour thing, never to actually eat... but today I decided to have lunch there and boy, I'm I sure glad I did. Due to the new management, this place is what I would now consider a hidden gem. I sat near the kitchen and was able to watch the Chef plate his dishes and it was obvious this isn't your average chef. Turns out he used to work for Michael Mina. The presentation clearly shines- but not as much as the taste. I had the Heirloom Tomato Tartare and it was amazing. Some of the best heirloom tomatoes I have ever tasted, clearly their produce vendor is A+ quality. 

I met one of the owners, he was super friendly and attentive to my needs. And of course- last but not least, the bartender Cindy! Love her! Glad the new management kept her around :)

I'll be back for a meal and maybe some wine... but I'm not telling anyone about this now hidden gem! So shhh!
author: Deb K.

description:
We have experienced the worst service in the whole SF.

There was maybe 10 guests when we arrived. I asked a waitress if we can order from the table or if we have to order from the bar. She said table is fine and handed me menus. After 15 minutes of waiting we decided to order at the bar. 

Three meals, three drinks and water. Water never came and she brought the food without any silverware. When we wanted to order more, she never came and I had to go to the bar every time we wanted something.
author: Rasty T.

description:
The two women bartenders here are terrible.  Neither of them knew what a Negroni was and we had to tell them what was in it.  They have a good selection of liquors but it doesn't seem that the staff seems to know how to utilize them.  After watching them work for awhile I realized that most of the customers were ordering jack and soda so it made sense that they don't know how to make a classic cocktail.
I love a dive bar, but I don't love a bartender who doesn't know the basics.
author: suzanne c.

description:
First, my reason for only 3 stars: After ordering drinks our waitress never returned to see if we wanted food. 15 min. later we finally flagged her down and asked for menus. "For food?" she asked. Well, yes. This seemed a little strange. I ordered the porchetta banh mi, normally a favorite of mine. Louie's sandwich had very, very little porchetta. It was basically a veggie sandwich with a porchetta topping. This was disappointing because the pickled onions, aioli, etc. were really good together. They were just missing the meat. When our food came all 4 in my party had mostly empty drinks but none of us were asked if we'd like another round. Even when the waitress came back to clear the empty plates she didn't ask. We again had to flag her down to order a second round. 

What I did like: Louie's is off the beaten path and one wouldn't just stumble upon it, so some friends and I decided to try it for drinks & dinner on a weeknight. The atmosphere feels very casual and unpretentious, but still adult-like. And I mean for real unpretentious, not the fake SF kind that can make a place feel even more pretentious. The draft beer and liquor selection was great for a small bar; as a Michigan transplant I was excited to order a beer from my home state. With first impressions, I really wanted to love this place but I just can't.
author: Danielle T.

description: Hidden in an alley next to a glaucoma center, Louie's Bar is pretty rad. First off, they have my favorite drink Bulleit with a side of beer for a special price of $8! We ordered hot buffalo wings, potatoe skins, and miso calamari. The potatoe skins comes with fancy pork belly chunks on top. Delicious! The place itself was welcoming and service was as good as any bar can get. I would come back!
author: Kelly C.

description:
Came here for lunch with one of my company's clients.  Talk about a hidden gem.  If you don't live or work in SF, you wouldn't even know that this place existed.  

It's a small lunch menu, but when you come to a bar, you expect burgers, fries and a sandwich anyway.  

One word sums it all...tasty.  

And, the service was great.  Great speed, friendly and drinks were refilled and topped off without asking.

When I'm in this part of the city, I'm coming back.  I need to check it out during happy hour and football time.
author: Miss P.

description: I love Louie's Bar. The burgers are the best in the city. Fresh, juicy, delicious. I find myself mopping up any juice left on the plate with my fries. Salads are good. Environment is casual. The bartenders are really nice. Sadly some assholes hang here, but that makes the bartenders so appreciative of sweet folks. The gin and whiskey selections are fantastic. Love my Plymouth and Redbreast. Recently I tried the wings, also good, but nothing comes close to the burger. I try to eat here every time I come to the city. On Stevenson in the little alley between Howard and Mission. Great place!
author: Owen H.

description:
My friends and I frequent this bar as we go to school quite close. However, we make it a point to meet here often even when we are in other parts of the city. The drinks are great, we especially appreciate the beer/shot combos that are usually about $8. 

Even better is the atmosphere, service, and the food! An order of fries will feed a few people as a bar snack easily and the other options and meals have always been great. I have literally never been disappointed after ordering anything here.
author: Sydney F.

description:
For lunch Today, I was craving a Louie's burger, because they are the best in town, if you crave a good char-broil and a place that is not afraid to cook a real medium rare.

I sat at the bar, said "hi" to Cindy, all seemed normal, then I order the burger, and Cindy said "oh, you might want to look at the, they revamped the whole thing" 

The burger was still there, less basic choices, and they don't want to vary from how its' listed, but they did. The price went up quite a bit. Then I noticed they upgraded the kitchen, it does look a lot better.

The burger was absolutely fantastic, even better than before. I now can add a fried egg and it comes with Arugula on it, , my favorite leafy green and it was a perfect medium rare. I was juicy and charbroiled. 

The price was quite steep, it will have to be a special occasion burger.

One owner tried to spruce up Louie, when it changed from Harpoon Louies, they had white linen tablecloths. They also jacked up the prices, it did fly well.  It soon went back to the the dive bar feel.  I like the change, but the prices are a bit steep, and the the menu is much smaller, maybe there could be some improvement there. 

The staff is also crazy happy and attentive, which is not a bad thing, just took me off guard cuz Louies has been a no-muss hang out. The food came out very very fast, that is a plus too.
author: Monica H.

description: We asked for separate checks. The waitress replied "one table, one check". Last time the waitress had no problem issuing separate checks. We'll never come back again.
author: Lydia H.

description: Great fun.  Bartenders were great, friendly. Drinks were good, food was good.
author: Brad R.

description:
They just re-did this place and it is pretty great.  Their old menu was much bigger however this scaled down one is a huge leap in quality. 

Good drinks and food. 

TV's are streaming sports from the internet which is a little crappy but whatever.  Also need a new bench for seating.  Sinking into a red pleather hole is not conducive for drinking and eating bar food.  

Recommend for lunch, dinner, & happy hour drinks.
author: Alex A.

description: Excellent service and Amazing food. Like really amazing food. My favorite part is that their kitchen is open till 1AM. I can't wait to go back!
author: Chantel M.

description: Nice neighborhood bar and restaurant on Stevenson. I was there the night Niners were playing a game. As expected, it was super loud and busy. A waitress still managed to find us a table. These guys had used a table to house their bags. How civil? Anyways, our waitress was great. Good beer selection and the burger was awesome!
author: Sunil R.

description:
Solid choice for late night food in this area. Excellent drink selection on both the liquor and beer front- the $8 shot n' beer specials are especially good value in SF, the land of the $12 cocktail. 
The kitchen is clearly skilled, and the menu is focused on high end pub food, usually with some kind of gourmet twist. 
-Summer chicken sando was good but not great. The breading wasn't as crisp as I had hoped for and the aioli was pretty bland.
-Chicken chicharones was definitely an interesting plate. The fried chicken was very moist, and if I'm remembering right it had kind of a chimichurri sauce thing going on. Very original and tasty dish.
-Loaded fries. The potatoes were cooked _perfectly_ hat off to the man on the fry-o-lator! The "loading" of said fries was a little underwhelming. Pork belly, sour cream and green onions definitely added some heft to the fork, but the flavors weren't as incredible as they sounded on paper. Maybe it needs something else to set it off like a bit of dry spice?

Overall, I would definitely return to this place any time, even though we eventually got chased out of there because someone (bartender?) just kept turning up the shitty death metal louder and louder and louder.
author: Steve D.

description: As a bar this place is pretty good.   Lots of seating, good beers, pitchers, and they have food too!
author: Michael E.

description: This place is great. Sat at the bar both times, ordered the Kolsch both times. Had their tacos but have to say their wings are delicious. I ordered them well done so they're crispy and they got it right. The sauce on the buffalo wings were tasty and not too hot. The Bangkok wings were my absolute favorite tho. When I was full and no one else wanted anymore wings, I just scraped off the delicious flavor off the remaining wings.  I couldn't let it go to waste. As our plates were removed, I asked the bartender to never take it off the menu. She agreed. I'm sure I'll be back.
author: Bernadette M.

description: Came in to watch some Sunday night football and could not find anyone to seat us after standing around for a few minutes. Pretty disappointing...
author: Brad T.

description:
Love this spot! I used to work in the high rise right in front of it and we'd sneak in here all the time for Happy Hour. The ambience is great, and I like how the crowd is usually exclusive to professional / working class, unlike the low lifers in bars on Market St and on 2nd. 

The bar and grill is great! There's something about the brick walls, wooden floors, cute bartenders and back alley location that makes it feel just so right. Did I mention that the cell reception, at least for AT&T, is pretty bad so it's perfect to lock out the world and have some me-and-friends-and-beer time.
author: Kevin N.

description:
This place has shockingly good food for what looks like a hole in the wall bar.  The burgers are absolutely the best I've found on this coast, and the vast majority of my friends agree on that point.  The rest of the food is also quite good.  

It does get a bit loud during game times, and it's quite busy around noon on week days, but overall it's an amazing place.
author: Noah R.

description:
This place was awesome! We came in around happy hour time and it was definitely busy. We were lucky enough to get a seat quickly and the crowd cooled of around 5:45. The drink is affordable and the food is great! 
We got a burger that was up there as one of the best burgers I have ever had. Next time I'll be opting for the bacon or fried egg on top. Also tried the panzanella salad and corn. Both home runs! My one complaint is that they added some sweetness to the already sweet, sweet potato fries. (That a lot of sweet for one sentence) Wasn't terrible but just not my favorite. Next time I'll be getting the salt and vinegar fries. Saw some of the other food and it looked equally amazing. Do not be scared to come to this place for a dinner. You won't be sorry!
author: Chris M.

description: Thank God that there is a bar that sells large cocktails behind my school. Someone was thinking when they did that. I've had a couple of bites of one of their sandwiches and it was awesome- I foresee lots of friday afternoons here with good drinks and food! Service is kind and pretty attentive!
author: Stephanie D.

description: I really love these guys. There are multiple choices in the financial district, but they always got me for a good crowd and a great vibe. Cindy is so awesome, she will remember your order from the last time she saw you, down to the condiments. Joey always shows the most love. The food is great, get there before 3 pm for lunch and they got you. The chef is great and he gives all his food the artisan touch. My girls always stop here when they visit from LA or we stalk the chef over at box kitchen.
author: Alicia W.

description:
As you will see, most reviewers are doing the "old Louies V. new Louies" thing here and I will hop on that train too.

Old  Louie's Service:
Cindy-YES!
Attitudinal Servers/Fat, mean cook fighting with servers-NO
New Louie's Service:
Cindy: YES!
Servers: YES! and guess what....it doesn't take 55 minutes to get your food anymore.YAY!

Old  Louie's Menu:
Most Everything-Meh
New Louie's Menu:
Pork belly/brisket sandwich was extremely flavourful, but my bun (delicious english muffin) got soggy...and WAY too much fatty pork belly. Chimichurri was EXCELLENT
Side Salad was gorgeous.
Snakebite was awesomesauce

Old  Louie's Happy Hour:
$5 for a shot and a beer, RIGHT up my alley. -Unequivocally YES!
New Louie's Happy Hour:
I might be missing something but I don't think they have one. This would be my only suggestion/complaint. You ABSOLUTELY, in no way shape or form can have a bar in an alley in the FiDi with no Happy Hour. And you can't just knock off $1 and call it HH, that's some Outer Sunset shit. You have to have drink specials and a true HH.

anyway all you old Louie's folks....get over it, there's a new kid in town. I for one will be back.
Cheers YelpFam
author: emma g.

description:
I came here with co-workers on a Friday.  I must say, it was a pleasant experience!  It's a bit harder to find, since it's not on a main road.  We sat at the bar, and our beers and old fashions did not stop flowing.  It seemed that every time my beer was emptied, there was a bartender ready to pour another one up.

If you are here for happy hour, you NEED to try their potato skins.  You'll see.  Just take my advice.
author: Andrew H.

description:
This is an update to my previous review.

Came here for lunch to catch a game, but also wanted to see if the place was different (after hearing that there was an ownership change and menu overhaul). I had the chicken sandwich. First thing first...it came out in a reasonable amount of time. Next, the fried chicken sandwich was actually really good. I'd come back just to have it again, but now I'm curious about how the other items on their menu taste.
author: Rick T.

description: If there was an option to give no stars at all, I would've. I came in looking forward to a happy hour drink. Sat down at not so crowded bar, and nothing... The bar made walked past me several times without a hint of acknowledgment ... Very disappointing.
author: tanya y.

description: Visiting SF for work. Was looking for a chill atmosphere to get a cold beer and some good grub. After scrolling through Yelp decided to give Louie's a try. The joint offers good beer at a good price, good food, and friendly service. The place is a little loud, but everyone appeared to be having a good time. Worked for me.
author: Kyle B.

description: I love this bar! I don't know why they call it a dive bar (although it's owned by the same people who own the Tempest, which is my favorite dive bar). The food is ridiculously good, and the drinks are strong and cheap. The vibe is usually a very work-happy-hour crowd, because of its location, but not a douchey vibe to the bar itself at all.
author: Niki P.

description: The absolute best place to go for lunch and drinks downtown. The staff is great and will make you feel like Norm in Cheers. The food is also great and there's a large selection of drinks. Try the house wings for a radiant surprise. They're delicious and large. It's got an upscale feel and there's limited seating during the lunch rush, but I always feel like I'm being prioritized by the friendly folks here.
author: Sam G.

description: The food here is really good! Bartenders and waitresses were really nice and gave us real drinking tips. This bar brings a friendly crowd and is a great environment to catch up with old friends. Only reason it's not 5 stars is because it's a bit small.
author: Chris N.

description: Best Burger in San Fransisco one of the top 3 best burgers I've had in my life. Great atmosphere and very reasonably priced. Staff is also very helpful and accommodating. I accidentally spilled my half drinker beer and they gave me another one free of charge.
author: Jeff D.

description: Based on the burger I just ate, 5 stars!!! I don't know if they always come out this way, but this may be the best burger I've ever had!!!
author: Jennifer A.

description: A Canadian, an Englishman and a Californian walking into a dive bar. Amazing appetizers! Great bar staff! Definitely "High End" Dive bar if you want to label it as such.
author: CJ T.

description:
I met my friend here for drinks after work. She, not being a fast drinker and having to drive back to San Jose, nursed her two (overpriced) glasses of wine. I was drinking at a normal speed AND eating a crappy sandwich from Louie's. The staff STILL tried to rush us saying they needed our table. When I said we were sitting at a table for two eating AND drinking, the server just said "well, hurry it up, you're cutting into my tips." Actually, I think her bad attitude was cutting into her tips.

Anyway, there are plenty of other places for after work drinks in the general vicinity. I suggest you go to ANY of them before coming here.
author: Rebecca H.

description:
Long story short, the floor was packed and while we waited on the super busy staff to adjust seating for us, I saw a space open up with two consecutive tables and one other table. I went up to this guy who was sitting on this one table and watching TV, waiting for his beer to arrive. We spoke and he agreed to my request of moving to the next vacant table as that would have freed up 3 consecutive tables and would have made space for 10 of us who wanted to sit together.
Next, enters the bar manager and asks that guy to sit back in his seat. He then came up to me and very rudely asked me not to talk to his customers. I told him that its fine to tell me that he didn't like it but it's not fine to be insulting and rude to me. He went on to say that it was his bar and he could do whatever the f*** he wanted to. I was shocked! Looks like the bar manager has anger issues and if he cannot control it for customers, I wonder how he handles the staff of this place. Regardless I will not enjoy in a place where people serve their customers on cheeky pride.

This place deserves two star for  it's mediocre food but a negative rating  for having no respect for its customers.
author: Melinda M.

description: This is where my co-workers go for company happy hour and I wish they'd find someplace else. The owner was extremely rude when we were there and made it difficult for anyone to order a drink. Not exactly what you want to be dealing with at 5pm when 6 different offices are crammed into this narrow, tiny bar. The drinks themselves are nothing special and there is far too much noise for anyone to have any semblance of a conversation. Pass...Unless my company springs for drinks again.
author: Josephine L.

description: Delicious food. Awesome staff. Friendly ambiance. Great place to relax, eat, and watch the game. Highly recommended
author: Ricky V.

description: This place is great. I popped in craving a burger and this place did not disappoint. Bacon, bourbon BBQ jam on the burger...omg. They had an impressive list of craft tap beers and bottled beers. The whiskey/bourbon/scotch/brown stuff selection was very impressive as well. Service was on point and the vibe was great. Could be my new regular burger spot for lunch.
author: J S.

description: This place was super crowded and loud even though it was a Monday. I had the Manhattan, which was nice and some happy hour drink that tasted like moscow mule. The sweet potatoe fries were yummy, had a coat of either tamarin salt or something. I do have to say it gets overwhelming once you eat more, maybe lighten up on the coating. The wings were amazing, I forgot which one. I just remembered it was the second wing choices on the HH menu, came with 6 I believe. Overall, not a bad hang out place. You may need to shout to have a conversation :-).
author: Nhung T.

description: We were at a conference for a few days and this became "our place". Its not a dive, its not pretentious - its comfy! Drinks are awesome, staff are very very cool and friendly, food was amazing! Bangkok wings 3 nights in a row, and missing them now that Im home. If I get back to San Fran any time soon - Im headed back to the best lil bar in the city.
author: Teri Y.

description: Absolutely the #1 spot to watch sports game & enjoy good food in the FIDI area. Only down side is that it can get very crowded as early as 4pm, but apparently Monday ain't bad at all during basketball season, and their services are great. Particularly this female waitress, Aiyisha, who is very professional, friendly, and accommodating to all customers' needs. Always feel blessed to come here when there's room to sit down and watch the game plus eating their potato skins, highly recommended :)
author: Keoini H.

description: This is a little place with an awesome atmosphere! You have to try the potato skins they are the best! It can get a little loud but that's what I expect from a busy bar:-)
author: Charles S.

description: fun late night spot, i work at a hotel a few blocks from louie's and i have been sending our guests there for some late night foods. highly recommend if you are looking for some grubs after 12 am.
author: eric d.

description: This place is phenomenal. We were directed there by someone who called it the place to go for late night eats. In addition to superb customer service  the food was on point. Get the pot pie appetizers and burger with all the fixing. Pair it with one of the great beers on tap to complete the experience.
author: Sawmon J.

description: My friends and I came here on New Years Eve at around 10:30 at night and there wasn't a lot of seating left, which means it must be a pretty popular spot. It is in a little alley. It is a really nice bar. The drinks aren't too expensive. The atmosphere was really great. The only downside is like i said not in a very convenient area. You have to walk around a building and that is the only way to get to the bar.
author: Avi W.

description: Awesome bar and restaurant in the heart of the financial district. Its tucked off on a side alley and is intimate with a lot of charm. I highly recommend the potato skins, the chicken wings, and the burger.
author: Jane G.

description: What a gem of a place. Amazing burgers and the buffalo chicken sandwich is to die for. Hard to go back to work after the lunch-induced food coma though ^__^
author: Melissa R.

description: Bartenders are friendly and efficient.  The food is good.  I'd like to give it four stars, but it is way, way to loud in there.
author: The P.

description: It's called Louie's and their logo features a sperm whale with it's ribs exposed. Those two things alone should be enough to intrigue any bar crawler.The fact that Louie's is tucked away in an unassuming alley is just icing on the cake, or in this case, the froth on your beer. It's a simple bar, nothing fancy, but it has character. It's a nice alternative to the more posh bars, bistros and eateries in the Financial District. With tap selections like  Allagash White and Pranqster, beer lovers will have nothing to complain about. There were also several trendy IPAS on tap. But it was the Victory at Sea Porter that blew my mind,  FAN-FREAKIN-TASTIC. If you get a bit peckish, Louie's has a nice bar menu. I ordered up a pastrami sandwich with potato fries and was impressed by the quality and the thought that went into the dish. Next time I'm in the area, I will surely return!
author: Eric C.

description: Mark was great, fantastic selection of beer and a phenomenal burger. glad we stumbled upon a great meal.
author: Barry T.

description:
I like that they have food here. The food isn't the best, but it is fine pub grub, and it'll put some grease in your belly to keep the booze company.

This place doesn't feel like a San Francisco bar. There's something about it, I can't figure out just what, that makes it feel much more suburban. I expect to get into an SUV parked in a big lot when I walk out of this place. I expect freeways and a house in the 'burbs. Louie's, you are a strange time/space portal.

I think that in addition to the fun location (in an alley), you get an eclectic mix of patrons here. Worth a visit.
author: Wes T.

description: This used to be the go-to hide out bar. Then new owners came in and changed up the menus and feel. I've tried them three times since the change and sadly will no longer return. Some folks may like the change, if so then a sincere kudos to the new owners and best of luck.
author: Ragenvald G.

description: Popular with people who work in the area. A little small and configured awkwardly. But it's ok.
author: Vol T.

description:
This page is a duplicate of the main page and should be removed. 
Main Yelp page:
http://www.yelp.com/biz/louies-bar-and-grill-san-francisco
author: Chris S.

description: Cute bar near FiDi and close to my work. The drinks are a reasonable price (I am not sure if we were there for HH pricing or not), strong and the atmosphere nice but not stuffy. I wasn't able to try any of the food and definitely want to come back for that!
author: Amber M.

description: Great place!  The food is amazing!   The drinks are awesome and Jacob the bartender makes you feel at home.  I live in LA and would put this in my top 5 of all my favorite places (next to the Tempest, same owner in SF).  Thanks for the great experience!
author: chris m.

description:
I've been coming here for about 2 years. They just got new ownership about 2-3 months ago (same guys that own tempest) and the menu has really stepped it up.

Before the new ownership, the place was a borderline divebar, but they've definitely switched it up and cleaned up the decor and the food. I've had the cheeseburger and pork belly sando (on a giant english muffin) that were both very good (for comparison: the burger is better than superduper burgers and the pork sando was unique, filling, and had a lot of flavor).

Also - shout out to Cindy the bartender! She's been there since the old ownership but is a great bartender - always remembers customer's names, drinks, and just a really nice lady.
author: James M.

description:
I have never eaten here but what I like about Louie's is it is never too crowded and never too empty.  Not too loud and not too dead.  It's not too big and not too small.  You have your typical bar crowd of drunken fools and happy hour business folk unwinding, girls out with the girls and I already mentioned drunken buffoons but what do you expect, it's a bar.

I found the drink prices reasonable and the bartenders gracious.

This place is a good choice in a downtown with just few good choices to socialize over drinks.  I like it's somewhat secretive location too.
author: Jake S.

description: So you have one of the best burgers in town, and then football season starts and you change the menu to stuff + buttermilk biscuits? And it's the regular menu for the season? Shame.
author: Ben R.

description: Came here around 6:45 for a drink and dinner. There had a pretty good menu considering its a bar. I got the fish sliders and they were GREAT! My friend got a burger and loved it. The waitress was also really attentive which was awesome since the bar was pretty full.
author: Alexandra W.

description: Pretty good dive bar behind school -- never too crowded, pretty chill.  Nice selection of beers on tap!
author: Mel G.

description:
Really like this place. Almost don't want to review it as I don't want it to get more popular.
Food and drink all great.

Suggestion: it's a lot less crowded come around 8pm or so.
author: Jonathan H.

description: Hidden away, good waitstaff and pleasant bartender(s), a bit hard to find, but nicely situated.  Happy hour specials are reasonably priced, and try the calamari!!!
author: R J.

description:
Louie's  just seems like a secret bar for those who work around it. I love it, its not super crowded, but there are a lot of people. The layout just allows for a lot of people without cramming them in a small area.

Good beer selection and yummy fries. Definitely going back to try more soon.
author: Analisa S.

description:
I partied here one night for an open bar all you can drink event. It also happened to be one of the bartender's birthdays and she drank like a champ.

OPEN BAR! Do I have to repeat myself?! 

Parking just sort of sucked.
author: Susy C.

description: Incredible!!! Never thought a bar could serve such 5 star dishes. Some of the best cuisine we have had in the city! A must!...and impeccable music!
author: Chad M.

description:
What a great lunch spot!  Hidden in the alley with a small entrance, unsuspecting passer-bys would never know it was there, and even so, a peek inside would not give much of a hint as to what awaits inside.  But once you've committed yourself to walk in and try the place out, you'll be surprised to find a cozy bar that is neither a dive (Beale Street) nor fancy.  It's not old and dark like Harrington's, instead it's clean while being an old-fashioned bar.  It's an uncrowded comfortable place for a casual lunch.  

Their generous serving of fries were so good I couldn't believe it.  They come in your choice o regular, cajun, and garlic.  Even the regular comes lightly peppered already.  Had to eat every last piece.
author: Chanson H.

description: I LOVE THIS PLACE! Absolutely everything about it! The music and atmosphere are great. They kitchen is open to late and located close to Montgomery bart!! The food is by far the best bar food I've had in SF!
author: Steph B.

description:
Great beer and fried food.  Need I say more?  All right, I will.  

The light-battered fries were delicious--long, crispy, thin, and perfect without any other condiments.  I also had the fried calamari (sprinkled with fresh chopped jalapenos), cheese quesadilla, and chicken wings.  But the BEST was the fried chicken and waffles--crispy fried indulgence at it's best to satisfy your savory and sweet tooth.  Did I mention they were fried?

I haven't even started on their beers.  The Guinness was ample enough for a knife and fork--just how I like it.  I also sampled the Hefeweizen, Pale Ale, and Pilsner.  Hey, if you're gonna get a gut, you might as well enjoy it.
author: M A N I K.

description:
One of the most disgusting bathrooms I've EVER seen.  Rivals the one in Trainspotting: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IJrWlHRT-18

Clearly, the bathroom is not of importance to the management.  It looks like it's never, EVER been cleaned before: big clumps of black gunk clustered around the perimeter of the sink...  Truly nasty.  For its location (Financial District), and the amount of money they must make, this is absolutely shameful.  How can a customer feel good about eating the food there when the bathroom is so awful?  A direct reflection of how much the owners/managers care about their business, which is to say "Clearly, not much".  One might make the case that Louie's is a dive bar, and that such things are to be expected.  To this argument, I say that Louie's IS NOT a dive bar; it is a DOWNTOWN bar.  Casual, yes, but not a dive.  Its patrons are not a bunch of bleary-eyed 20-something students/hipsters; they are Downtown FiDi types, and as such, Louie's should take a little pride in how they present themselves, and have a bathroom that reflects the taste/affluence of their customer base.  One might also make the argument "What does the bathroom have to do with the quality of the establishment?".  To this, I say "Quite a bit".  I shouldn't have to tell the management this; they should already know it.  Perhaps, one day, when Louie's finally catches on to these basic principles of running a business, it'll be a decent place.  Until then, I'll skip it.

To be fair, the fries are good.
author: Eric H.

description: AMAZING food. AMAZING bartenders. Eric always greets me with a smile and a handshake. Couldn't ask for a better neighborhood bar.
author: Noelle G.

description: Nice vibe. Very good food. Shot  plus Hams special!  Getting more crowded as the word gets out.
author: jonny s.

description: The burger was awesome! You definitely need to get the bacon jam on it, which makes it unique and flavorful. I also switched out fries for a side salad, and it was a good side salad with good balsamic dressing. Great service too!
author: Mark L.

description: Took a large group to Louie's for dinner a couple weeks ago. Was really impressed by the quality of the food and the service. I heard they are under new management, and it is definitely different than the last time I was in there- the ambiance is way better and there was a really good crowd. Definitely coming back.
author: Andy P.

description:
