Very good place for a late lunch/happy hr. There is no noticeable sign for this gem in the alley, but it is right next door to a Mexican joint. Don't even try to show up at noon on a Friday and expect a table or food unless you can wait an hr. 

Food is delectable. I would recommend the BLT and fries. Or just go with a delicious cheeseburger. Either way, you won't be disappointed.
author: Andrea L.

description: So, there really is absolutely NOTHING fancy about this place.  It's stuck behind Yank Sing on Stevenson and is usually filled with accountants/tax guys/finance nerds (Deloitte, Ernst & Young, and KPMG) are literally within an arms length (finance/accounting joke) of each other.  Anyway, on a night when it isn't busy, this place is a good quiet spot to have a low key happy hour.  On a busy night when there are people lined up to where the staircase is, it's one of the worst places.  My co-workers and I have frequented this place enough to where Cindy (the owner, I think) knows us and pushes a few tables together to make space for our crew.  She knows a few of our drink orders (I swear we do a lot of work during the day time) and asks us for our food order.  The food, well, it's toeing the line of being bad.  The nachos we usually have evolved from being the "Nasty Nachos" to "Not Again Nachos".  I mean they are really just not that good. Now, their fries have made a HUGE comeback.  They were already really great (straight from the freezer bag, but whatevs), and now they've brought in SEASONED fries!!  After a few shots of Fernet, those little things are pure gold.  Like I said, this place is a definite crap shoot and I would never say that this place is great.  That being said, Cindy's awesome (the rest of the staff is subpar and rude) and when we've caught it on a quiet day, it's a pretty fun night.  Check it out if you're on 2nd and Mission if you're interested :)
author: Lisa I.

description:
Cool place to grab a quick bite before our group movie.  Especially if you like to have shots with your burger.

For those of you like me who can't eat a whole burger with a bun,they are happy to make it bunless. :)

The onion rings are also a treat.

This place is packed seemingly all the time but it's worth checking out if you need a meet up location in SOMA.
author: Nikki M.

description: Best burger downtown.  That it's not on any of those "best burger" lists is only because the secret isn't out yet.  Hurry up, before there are 2 hour waits and the price goes to $22.  Staff is chill but friendly and attentive.  Great food, great drinks, perfect place to unwind.
author: Lucas M.

description: I think this place was great. I went with few of my friends, we just hung out and relaxed. The food was great. Its a really "chill" place to just hang out. I think next time we go will get better seats because this time the sitting wasnt to great. Overall great place to go hang out!
author: Max P.

description: Love Louie's!  Great food, drinks and service!  Cheers!
author: Clay R.

description: Busy and loud.  We had a bit of a wait to get in at lunch time, but it was worth it.  The server at the bar had a great personality and the food was phenomenal.
author: Raymond M.

description:
Just went there for after-work drinks. 
They make stiff drinks, I liked their lemondrops! Also, we had battered zucchini  and popcorn shrimp. Both were really good, though zucchini was a little bit on the oilier side.

Have to try out more from the menu.
author: Parminder Nayyar C.

description:
Good beer, good people, good food. After-work haven on Stevenson.

Get the Cajun fries with the Big Daddy IPA, you won't regret it.
author: Robert T.

description: Revisit on the review. Louie's has become a great stand by for after work drinks - usually not overcrowded so long as you can grab a table or a bar stool it's a great spot to sit down and toast the day with a side of sweet potato fries. The bathroom isn't great, the service can be slow, but as long as you're not in a rush and don't expect a 5 star kinda place, you're golden. Love the brickwork walls.
author: Mel H.

description:
I enjoy a fancy/pretentious/dimly lit wine bar as much as the next gal... but sometimes I just want a drink.  So I come to Louie's for the easygoing atmosphere, the quick and friendly service (Cindy is amazing!), and the reasonable prices.  

One caveat: if you have AT&T this place is an absolute deadzone (which is perfect when you're ready to unplug from emails at 5pm on a Friday)
author: Vanessa K.

description: The food is great, the atmosphere is great, the beer is cold, and management (Cindy) rocks... but one of their servers is the worst! I like it there, so I go frequently. But it routinely takes 40+ minutes just to get nachos. Cheese, chips, and jalapenos. Get rid of the one server, it would be a five star spot.
author: Rob W.

description:
I should preface this by saying that I have wanted a buffalo chicken sandwich for approximately 3 months now, going so far as to walk to the Denny's on Mission, which totally served these as recently as a decade ago, only to discover that they, like every other establishment that fit within my criteria of (1) being walking distance from me when I am hungry and (2) not being up a hill, don't want me to have nice things.  So this review may be biased.

At a loss for what to eat for lunch, because I am full of first world problems, I said that I didn't care what we ate because nothing sounded good, and "all I really want is a buffalo chicken sandwich, but I would settle for a fried chicken sandwich with slaw on top."  We chose Louies as a compromise because it is close, has seating, and is too dark for a passerby (read: boss or client) to walk by and see us eating at a leisurely pace.  The burger is great, the Tempest (in either iteration) is delicious, and the menu changes enough that there is always something new.  Well today, as if God himself was smiling down upon me to make up for a life's worth of bad boyfriends and that time I got the H1N1, the menu boasted a new (to me) addition:  Buffalo Chicken Sandwich, with Buttermilk Ranch Slaw.  It may be the luckiest day of my life; I may, in fact, play the lottery today so that I will have enough money to hire a chef to make me buffalo chicken sandwiches at my every whim.

In summary, the sandwich was delicious.  I did that thing my mom always hated where I hummed and danced when I ate (which she believed showed an unhealthy fondness for food and a propensity for weight gain), and the waitress carded me and not my coworker, which made me feel like not an old crone.  To show I am not overly seduced by my sandwich, my only criticism was via my coworker who wished that the sourdough english muffin buns on her patty melt were not "inside out," so that the juice would have soaked into the nooks and crannies.  But forget about her -- please never take away that buffalo chicken sandwich.
author: Sarah W.

description: This is/ was my favorite treat for myself on payday friday. I haven't been in a couple of Fridays so today I take my book hop up on the bar stool and I young lady I've never seen before who is very nice starts to give me a menu I've never seen before, and I say I know what I want fish&chips, she says sorry we don't have those any more we are under new management and there is a different menu oops my record just scratched.  Ok so I look at the new menu, nothing throws my hair back so I order a caesar  salad wrap. Don't do it the chicken was dry I mean DRY no you don't get it DRYYYYYYYYY. I might go back and try something else but stay away for the Caesar Salad wrap
author: Linda S.

description: Zack is the best bartender I have encountered. He is pleasant, ready to fill your glass, and very helpful with suggesting other restaurants. The drinks were outstanding; from the Hamm's, to the Pranqster Golden Ale, and even the Moscow Mule made with BundAberg ginger beer. My husband and I shared the buffalo hot wings and loaded fries, both of which were incredible and more than enough good for the both of us; although it was after 4pm and neither of us had eaten all day. The wings were the largest I've seen and very flavorful, they were also sprinkled with blue cheese crumbles. The loaded fries had a citrusy, sour cream sauce which was absolutely amazing. I would DEFINITELY recommend this bar to anyone venturing down to San Francisco. The bar has been revamped to showcase their alcohols and the brick walls add a vintage feel to the homey atmosphere. If you are looking for a relaxing place to grab a brew and some amazing food, just head on down to Louie's. I can guarantee you won't be disappointed.
author: Becks R.

description: Still a 3. Right before lunch my coworkers were talking about this great burger spot and when I got here I realized that I've been here before. I never knew that the burgers were such a big deal so I ordered The Burger. I think 1 that they could have been a little more creative picking the name. But whatever that's not why I'm rating 3 stars. The burger was actually really good and so was the service. Why a 3 then? I think the waiter was great and really friendly but she got my order and and my friends' order all wrong. My coworker ended up getting more than he ordered and I ended up getting less. Since we ordered different cheeses he didn't want to just swap, plus I ordered fries instead of a salad. But basically I ended up taking the egg and bacon from his burger to complete my actual order. The extras a bit pricey and they even charge for tomatoes in your burger. As I recall I paid $9 for the burger and ANOTHER 8 or 9 dollars just for my toppings. Definitely not worth coming for a $20 burger. Again I'll stick to the tacos I had the next time I come back.
author: JJ S.

description:
The setting inside reminds me of a dive bar, but the food is delicious.

I have gone here twice this summer, and each time I've gotten a grilled cheese sandwich with avocado and onion rings. The best thing about this place is the happy hour drink specials--$2 well drinks and $2 beers with a lunch entree.

Very reasonable!

Also, we asked for separate checks for our party of 6, and were totally accommodated. It was great.
author: Caitlin B.

description: It's always been good. But after the "rescue" from the tempest folk, things couldn't be better (tv's, menu upgrade, better music, excellent staff, cheap drinks, location location location...) Will remain loyal as long as I'm around the joint.
author: Ed G.

description:
What's that "Cheers" tune?  How does it go again?  Something about everyone knowing your name.  But in my memory, it mentions something about down-trodden and everyone being forgiving too.  Accepting you for the drunken, not as successful person that you are.  

The service here was good.  The waitress was attentive and very nice, with personality so I give her a star.  It's not her fault that the fry-a-lator guy didn't know what the eff a timer was, nor did he know that to achieve greatness in chicken wings, you have to fully cook them.  Generally from room temperature.  And if they start out frozen, you have to fry them a little longer.  For the sake of Pete, make sure they have the crispy skin on the outside, even if they have no flavor but for the firey burn of orange glaze.

The fries were EXECELLENT!!!!  I don't even care that I spelled that wrong.  The fries here, are the only saving grace.  Plain, without that garlic faux-good and without cajun masking powder (if you wanted cajun, you could have brought your own powder, or better yet, used that Japanese red sprinkles pepper stuff that makes udon so much more delicious!).  The way the fries came out, it made me forget that McDonald's is around the corner, that they have frying down to a science that even slivers of human beings can accomplish feats of physics-defying crispness.  
If you've ever bitten into that perfect fry, been pleasantly surprised, and then fought your dining mate for the rest of the basket, you know what I'm referring to.  It makes us all a little "Mr. Hyde."

The crowd here gave me the heebie-jeebies.  They were, as I referenced above in the Cheers theme song that I kind of made up, people that don't go to Zebulon, Salt House, Rickhouse, or any of the other places young, hip, trendy, assistant VP whose daddies are the real VPs and can't get their act together enough to get an MBA.  They are the people who compare Eugene, OR, and the river they have there with the Bay.  A group of girls in slutty business attire bought off the rack from Wet Seal (are you getting the mental image) with bright pink logo hangbags and sensible shoes sat right next to me and Lou. 
It was as though we couldn't get out of there fast enough.

Service was good.  Drinks were non-alcoholic so I cannot comment.  Price was not terrible but high for the ambiance that I absorbed.  Fries were out of this world fantastic.
author: Christina C.

description:
I've been to Louie's many of times but not because i like it but because it's right outside my office building.  I think the service is terrible, staff can be rude, dont really pour a good drink and sometimes, it kinda smells in there.  Their wine selection is terrible.  I mean, we're in California where the wine options are abundant so there isn't any excuse why a bar can't have a decent wine list.  Just takes a little research.  

I gave it two stars because i've had a few good times there but that's because of the crowd i was with and the fact that they don't like to walk far for a drink after work.
author: chloe b.

description: Good drinks but what the eff were those beef tacos. Was like eating cardboard! Next time I'll just need to get the sweet potato fries and beer.
author: Angela K.

description:
$15 all night for open bar of well drinks, beer and sake.  We couldn't say no.  Especially to Sapporo on tap.

Throw in the option to order inexpensive sushi rolls?  We're so there.

The bartenders are super friendly and know when to cut people off.  Definitely a good skill to have.
author: Jenny L.

description:
Came here for lunch on a Friday with some friends.  I've had the fish and chips before which were very tasty; fries crispy.  The fish were nice large portions.  
BUT this time I had to try the burger and fries.  And oh my, my burger was super juicy, the meat was delicious.  What stood out to me was the bun was really soft and seems like it was lightly toasted with butter, which is just a strong vessel to hold up to the flavorful meat and veggies of the burger.  An absolute must try whether you get fish and chips or burger and fries is the CAJUN fries! Oh my they were very crispy and full of seasoning and flavor.  Not at all too salty or too bland.  Dip the cajun fries in ranch and it's pretty damn good.  
Portions for burger and fries are good too, split it with a friend if you rather have a light lunch.  But me I didn't want to share hehe.. I just ate half for lunch and scoffed down the other half after work.  
The only reason why it got 4 stars instead of 5, was food take a bit long to get, but once we got it.. none of us had any complaints.
author: Kim L.

description:
I work very close to Louie's and it's always been a favorite haunt of my co-workers and myself. It's an awesome liitle dive bar in an alley that's not taking itself too seriously (at least that used to be the case, read on for more info). You feel you can go in and have a beer after work without being surrounded by the "club" atmosphere you get at some other places. That being said, don't expect any great happy hour deals there. It doesn't bother me so much, but it's a peeve of many of my co-workers that there aren't really any good deals around happy hour time. 

But onto the real reason they are only getting 3 stars.... my co-workers and I used to go to Louie's for lunch EVERY Friday to get the chicken tenders. Now, I realize I have the taste preferences of a five year old, but seriously I love chicken tenders and ranch, I'd consider myself an expert on the subject. These were the best chicken tenders and ranch I have ever had. Anywhere. That's a HUGE compliment coming from me. 

But recently (about a month ago now I think) Louie's was sold to new owners. The completely re-vamped the menu and of course, because my luck is awful, they took away the tenders. Now all I can do is dream about them. For many weeks we didn't go back because we were so sad about the tenders but we recently gave them their fair chance and I do have to admit, their food is pretty good. I had the B.L.T.A and my co-workers all had the burger (they said the burger was good). Sidebar -- Now this isn't technically a problem, but their menu is just stupid, they are trying to be cool or something and they call their sandwiches 'sandos,' I'm sorry but I think that's just plain dumb. Anyways,-- The menu options overall are pretty hipster, especially compared to the old Louie's. And let's face it, you're a bar in an alleyway, you should have plain, regular bar food. But anyways... the sandwich I had was pretty good, some of the bacon was a little burnt, but other than that is was tasty. The fries leave something to be desired in my opinion, nothing really special about them and they were slightly overcooked, plus they give you a pretty pathetic amount of them with your $10 meal of a sandwich and fries. The old Louie's used to really pile them on. They even changed their ranch dressing, which used to be amazing, I'll admit the kind they have now is still a lot better than most places around here so I'll accept it.

The chicken tenders being gone is my main complaint, but my second one is they have a lunch menu and a "happy hour menu." The happy hour menu has pretty cool items such as loaded french fries, but you can't order them until after 3pm. Why not? You have the fries, you have the cheese and all that and I know you are cooking fries at lunch time. Why can't you slap some cheese and such on my fries before 3pm? I can understand when places have lunch menus and dinner menus that are very different, the dinner stuff is often more involved and complicated to make, so they don't offer dinner stuff at lunch time. But this is a friggin' bar, you're serving burgers and fries. Really, you can't give me the loaded fries before 3pm? Annoying...

I will say the new servers are nicer and more attentitve than the old servers. And I'm super happy that Cindy is still there, she's the absolute best. 

Seriously, if the new owners are reading this please please please please please bring back the chicken tenders! I'm begging you! Find out where the old owners ordered them from and just give it a try. I know it doesn't fit in to your idea of your bar's style but I promise you will benefit in the sales. Keep your customers happy!
author: Jessie Y.

description: Cool place and good food, beer, and vibes BUT we had a super bitchy waitress. She was rude and messed up our order in 5 seperate ways. The dude w the beard was cool though
author: Jan M.

description:
Didn't try the food here, but I like this place a lot!

I came here on St. Patty's day, and for being such a crazy day, the service was impeccable! The drink specials are amazing! Especially the cheap beer deals everyday. That day, they had a Guinness and a shot of Jameson for $9, which I thought was a steal! 

The bartender that helped us out was very cute and she was very nice as well! We were never thirsty in this bar since she always got us drinks on point whenever we ordered them! 

Although it may be hard to find, I definitely recommend coming to this place!
author: Langdon N.

description:
When I worked in the SOMA area, I used to come here a lot when I wanted a good burger and fries, and I didn't want to go too far. Louie's definitely fits the bill on those points. The burger is a good size, nice flavor, and the fries here are great! Whether you get plain fries or garlic fries (never tried the Cajun ones so can't comment on that), they are perfectly fried to a golden crisp! They also have some pretty good chicken tenders and bbq pork sandwiches for those days when you're all burgered out.  I do wish that they'd add more nonalcoholic beverages to their menu, though. I'm not much of a soda drinker, but somedays a lemonade or sparkling cider would be nicer than just plain old water. 

The only other thing I will say is beware the lunch rush, as I've had times where I waited 45 mins. for my food to come out. It's definitely best to go around 1:30 pm, when the lunch rush subsides.
author: Meg P.

description:
I recently tried the Chinese Chicken Salad and Stephen hit it out of the park (even though the Giants didn't). Where do I start? 
You should know I am not a huge fan of any type of salad, but the DR mentioned I may want to cut my fried food intake (BOOOOOOring!!) 
OK OK, I say, let's give this Chicken Salad a whirl!
Where do I start to describe how happy ma bouche was?
Bed of lettuce sprinkled with roasted cashews and small citrus pieces. Top with roasted black rice (OMG where do I start with this??) Garnished with gorgeous shaved radish slices and THEN topped with (drumroll please) a slender, moist chicken breast (more roasted black rice). But let me not forget the humble fried lotus root chips that held my mouth hostage from the very beginning.
From top to bottom, I wish my mother had learned to cook like this and I would have eaten a salad everyday!
Yeah the bar food is wonderful, but don't let the Chinese chicken salad pass you by.
author: Citizen K.

description: I came her with some of my girls for a relaxing Friday lunch aka comfort food and I was not disappointed. I will say that it is nearly impossible (or that's what I told myself) to come in here and not have a drink. We had lemon drops and they were made right, not juiced down. My friends got the Philly cheese steak and a burger and they looked yummy! I ordered the BLT and it was just what the doctor ordered! The main attraction here is the CAJUN FRIES. I love any and everything spicy and these little firecrackers were perfection. Dip them in ranch for the perfect combination. My only complaint was the service was a little slow on a day that wasn't too busy, but I was so busy chatting with my girls that it didn't really matter.
author: Stephanie A.

description: Great food. Great service. Came to town on business and found this gem. Buffalo sando  was excellent. Will definitely be back.
author: phillip s.

description:
- Because it's Friday, I took a lunch break.  
- Because I'm a good friend, I went to a burger & fry place.
- Because I have to wear an effing bikini in Vegas at the end of March w/ 90-pound silicone-boobed popsicle sticks, I ordered a gardenburger, sans bun & cheese, sub fries for salad, with dressing on the side.  Not bad for rabbit food.

+1 star for the waitress unabashedly laughing at how lame my order was.
author: Janney B.

description:
If you going for an authentic Philly cheesesteak, this isn't the place to go...stick to Theo's over at Rincon. But if you're seeking a dark, friendly bar that has a good lunch menu, Louie's is a great place. 

Be forewarned...if you're running late and expect to call or text the person to tell them you're running late, don't bother: there's no cell reception once you're inside.
author: Paul W.

description:
Well, I'd read a few great reviews of this place, so a friend and I checked it out last night.

After about 2 hours and $60, we found that the food was okay, the drinks were decent (yet pricey), but the bar service was a bit spotty.  The actual bartender seemed more interested in checking her phone than checking on how things were after we got our food (ordered my burger medium, and it came out really close to well-done... then again, the patty reminded me of McDonald's anyway, so that really wasn't surprising).  One of the floor servers (who also apparently bartends) seemed more into the "service" aspect of the job than the actual bartender did, so kudos to her - she had a personality with more than just the bar regulars!

All in all, it was a bit "Meh, I've experienced better", hence the 2 stars.

I'll probably give it another shot sometime, but not anytime soon, methinks.
author: Jay B.

description:
When I worked downtown, only a hop, skip & a jump away from Louie's, my office window literally looked 10 floors down on this place. I would sit on the phone and daydream of cold beer & wings as the afternoon wore on. 

On more than a few occasions, my coworkers and I would wait until our boss left for the day & then have a special "work meeting" downstairs at Louie's Bar & Grill. In an effort to avoid the happy hour crowds, we would arrive early & open a tab with whichever friendly server/bartender graced us on that particular day. Funny enough, the staff never forgot us when the crowds arrived--they always made sure our glasses were full & our tummies properly satiated.

When I made the decision to leave the corporate world, my boss actually used some of our team's budget to send me off the right way at this spot. I have since returned to Louie's to visit with my old cronies, and have actually stopped in to Louie's by myself a few times for one MAJOR reason.

When it comes to San Francisco, I am a complete whore for free wireless internet. If you pair that up with a good selection of beer, and yummy bar food--I'm yours for the taking.

This is definitely more of a business person's establishment, but it's a good spot nonetheless.
author: matt m.

description:
Fun atmosphere for the post-work crowd. Decent selection of beers on tap and a good mix of cocktails. Drinks tend to be under-filled, so don't expect something that's splashing over the side. The calamari appetizer we had was good, but overly peppered. 

Also: Men, when you see two women sharing food and drinking and they look alike only one is about 30 years older than the other, they're probably related. I'm all for ratcheting up points for the "hard-sells" but you might want to think twice before hitting on a daughter in front of her mother. Just sayin'.
author: Devon S.

description:
The location is perfect: Half-way between my office and bart, tucked in an alley to boot.   Friendly bartender. 
The only reason I two-star it rather than three is b/c the bill always seems like you've drank way more than you actually have.
author: Meg W.

description: Warning: If you despise slow service both at the bar and for your food order, then Louie's is NOT for you.  However, if you like the idea of a secluded, brick-laden bar in the Financial District, one that won't charge you and arm, leg, and first born to drink at, come here.  C'mon, it practically sells itself.
author: Michael D.

description: Food is good but the service is extremely slow. If you only have a half hour or less for lunch stay away. Prices are reasonable.
author: Scott D.

description:
Great bar food...

And there is something about that bartender...
author: Nathan W.

description: I go here once a week.  It's a great place to have lunch with friends.  It's a relaxed place with beer, great bar food, and the best bartender you could ask for in the  FIDI.  Thanks, Cindy, for having customers for 5 years and going!
author: Andy S.

description:
Disclaimer:  I am friends with one of the co-owners

I have been to Louie's quite a few times and it's a cozy little kick-it spot in the FiDi/SOMA area.  Like others have said in previous reviews, a good spot for having some after work drinks with friends.  

The bar itself is long and narrow, and seating can be a bit of a problem at times when it's busy.  My friends have held several "Sushi Nights" there and it was a packed house.  Definitely try to make it the next time Sushi Night rolls around.  The bar usually does an all you can drink special for ~$15 on those events.

Food here is pretty good, although it's been awhile since I've ordered.  I am usually here to get my drink on.

Tip:  If you can't get into the bathroom at the front entrance, try downstairs....there's a secret bathroom near the kitchen area.
author: Wade Y.

description: Only good if you get here before the crowd. Otherwise, food is weak, drink selection is weak. No places to sit or congregate during happy hours or later.
author: Nick K.

description:
Harpoon Louie's
55 Stevenson Street
San Francisco, CA 94105-2959:

I gave Harpoon Louie's three attempts to cook something palatable. Each attempt failed miserably. My first meal started with the Pulled Pork Sandwich at $8.00 an experience that left me wanting for a Manwich. The pulled pork was served on too soft a bun as the pork was slathered in a tomato based product that some would dare to call a sauce.  Garden gloves sold separately.

The second disastrous encounter was the Burger and Fries Combo at $7.50. The beef was under-cooked; the Brit in me would call it Blue and the onion, tomato lettuce was wilted like it had been left out at Burning Man under the hot Black Rock sun. 

 As if that wasn't enough to dissuade me from further culinary abuses, I ordered the Fish and Chips combo with Coleslaw $9.00. I thought the cook had made a mistake when he brought out my order because I said "I ordered the Fish and Chips, not, the Chicken Fingers".  The chef was not amused, nor was I after I bit into what he called "a delicate fish fillet in a cornmeal crust".  It would have been better described as a Hush Puppy under a steam roller.......  This place gets my notorious "You Suck" rating, times three.
author: D Scott D.

description: This place is amazing if you know it here. It's located on Stevenson which is an alley-like street between Market St. and Mission St.. The appetizers are great (especially the hot wings) and the service is always awesome. By my third time in, the staff already knew my preferences and started asking me if I may want a Stella as I found a table, such that by the time I got settled, it was already there! Tina and Cindy are amazing behind the bar too! All in all, the vibe is chill, the drinks are cheap and the food is great!
author: Nii M.

description: Pretty decent place to drop in for a drink or two after work. People working here are pretty friendly. Normally I judge a place based on the price of a beer but fortunately for me someone else picked up the tab. All in all pretty cool bar and conveniently near my office!
author: Andrew M.

description:
Here's my one complaint: their cole slaw is REALLY GOOD, and yet their supply is typically so low, they won't let you sub it for the fries (instead saving it for people who order the fish & chips, which includes the slaw).  Slaw ain't difficult to stock, people.  The wait staff apparently fields these requests on a daily basis, yet this problem hasn't been resolved.  Bad Louie's!  No cookie for you!  No 5-star review for you.

That being said, the pulled pork sandwich is great, the fish and chips are great, and the fries you will have to eat because you can't eat the slaw are also pretty darn good.  Everyone raves about the Philly cheese steak sandwiches, which I don't eat because I'm alergic to green peppers.  There, now you know my one weakness!  I hope you're happy!
author: Ben P.

description:
I only go here for lunch. I've never tried it for an after work drink.

Best Philly Cheese Steaks I've come across in the Financial District.  I only come here when they have them on the menu (it rotates).

The bartender is ridiculously nice.  She knows I only come in here for the cheesesteaks, so when she sees me walk in, even if it's busy, she puts the order in and gets my drink of choice ready for me by the time I sit down.  Without me having to say a word. I love that.

And I have a soft-spot for exposed brick walls.
author: Matthew R.

description: If you like Cajun fries, this is the place. The BLT is really good too. Bartender Cindy is super nice and very helpful. The only downside, absolutely no cell service (AT&T). Nice beer selection and a great choice when in SOMA.
author: Rick W.

description:
There are two reasons I like Louie's: 1) it is right below my work - so I can pretty much fall into the bar while leaving work - always a nice option.  2) I really like the people that work there, always nice and friendly.  Their food isn't half bad either. 

Beyond that, this bar doesn't have anything real special.  Their happy hour isn't that great, because they never have drink specials on beer --- and that's just a shame.  Also, during happy hour it can get pretty crowded and loud --- but I guess all bars in downtown SF are like that during happy hour --- at least all the good ones.  

So I can't recommend you travel out-of-your-way to Louie's, but if you work in the area, feel free to make your way to this alley bar for a few drinks after work.
author: Josh M.

description:
My friend e-vited me to their Rockin' Sushi event the night before my birthday, so I ended up inviting more of my friends to go.  IT WAS GREAT!!!  Everyone was super friendly (or maybe it's just me) and the bartenders were a blast.  One of the bartenders even hosed me down with the soda fountain.  Thanks Louie's...  I spent most of my birthday morning recovering from that night.  hahaha!!!

Remember kids...  If you go to a great open bar, support your local Yellow cab driver.
author: Cin D.

description: I had walked by Louie's about a week ago never knowing it was there and then met up with a few friends for drinks on Friday night.  For being so hidden it was pretty packed inside.  The waitresses were very nice and on top of drink orders which is always a good thing.  They are also known for their dice playing so of course we had to oblige and play some liar's dice.
author: Blake B.

description:
Louie's is a great chill spot to come after work and knock back a few cold ones.  It's so layback and unassuming, a hidden gem in the alley next to Yank Sing.  I like how it's small and simple, and the staff is very friendly and attentive.  The happy hour specials are nothing to write home to mommy about, but the chill vibe more than makes up for it.  The food is actually pretty good too!  The burgers are huge and juicy, just the way I like 'em! The chilli cheese fries look delicious too...even though I couldn't eat any because it wasn't meal time for me yet - damn Invisalign!  

They also have dice in cups for dice games which some friends and I played for hours the other day.
author: James C.

description:
Wandered into this place by accident (it's in an ally off of Market Street).  I was with a buddy of mine and we were looking for a some food on a friday afternoon.The food was bomb, drinks were strong, and service was great.  The place was packed and this short brunette girl was serving the entire restaurant by herself (props to you--I used to work in a restaurant and I could never multitask like that).  These guys next to us where giving this girl a hard time about how long they had to wait for food even though my buddy and I both heard her say it was like 45 minutes for food. 
Anyways, this chick handled it so good...I wanted to punch these guys in the face for being so rude and she just smiled and asked if they wanted to talk to the cook about it. Plus we sat near the kitchen and it looked like there's one dude cooking for the whole place.  I finally leaned over and told these guys to shut it.... that's how obnoxious they were. So you had to wait a while for your salad...get over it buddy.
Anyways, I will definitely be back.  Bomb service, amazing burger, hot waitress (can I have your number???)
author: Steven K.

description:
This place is good for happy hour during the week, or if you want to hang out with friends and catch up, or maybe you want to catch a game on TV..... It works out well if you work close by...

Cindy and Tina are super cool will take good care of you!  What can I say?  This was where I first tried Hangar One Vodka...

No complaints on the food either....

The decor is relatively simple yet tasteful with brick walls...

Stevenson is a small street, but  this place is right next to Yank Sing, if you know where that is....

And its never too packed, but can get moderately busy...
author: Summit S.

description: Really hard to find bar, but definitely a cool atmosphere. Plus they just re did it and now it's got pretty good food too. Worth stopping by.
author: Aaron R.

description:
I work across the alley;  this is always a lively place to go after work.  It's not fancy by any stretch of the imagination, but the bar staff is always nice.  

It's a bar - the eats are so-so, nothing gourmet.  Just drink and be merry, kids.
author: Evan G.

description:
It looked good when i first stepped in.  But that's where the goodness ended.  The food was average and overpriced, but what really made this place a 2 thumbs down for me was their drinks.  They were RIDICULOUSLY expensive for being an after-work bar.  $10 shots?!?  are you kidding me?  and they refused to give us any water....tsk tsk.

That's one bar crossed off my list.
author: Tadd L.

description:
Yay! I love the bartender at Louie's. I went on my Birthday so everyone at the office can buy me drinks and get me totally wasted. A few friends and co-workers did, but the Bartender put me over. Thanks for the 2 shots of Crown!

Star deducted because my friend ordered Cajun Fries. 30 minutes pass, she had to go back to work. Inconveniently the waitress comes out with a basket of it... and charged us. Thanks. But, I give her props for allowing all my pals to pay with separate tabs.
author: Alyson C.

description:
As neighborhood pubs and typical pub food goes.. this is an average place. The food is on the 4-star side and the service is on the 2-star side. So, I split the difference and give it 3-stars. No-doubt, if you come off as a big tipper, you would likely get better service.  [For the record, I have been known to tip 25-30% when I get stellar service.. I tipped 10% here.]

There is much better food to be found in that neighborhood.. within 2 blocks, I could name 6 or 7, 4 and 5-star places with great service and much better atmosphere. Hell, the Mexican place right next door has better food! 

But, if you are looking for a greasy burger and over-spiced fries (not over priced, over-SPICED) to go with a seat at the bar and a TV playing ESPN, then this may-well be your place. I would call it pseudo-divey, but it is really just a mediocre working-class pub. Not trendy (in case that's your thing), not hoppin'.. just a place to get of the street and grab a burger or bar food and brew at lunch or after work. For that, it's A-okay.
author: Mark H.

description:
Love Louie's for Lunch
awesome fish and chips, and a good veggie burger. (i don't do meat, but alot of people like the burgers and cheesesteaks, i've been told). Super friendly bartenders, and the one man show in the kitchen is a thing of beauty. he rocks it back there. it takes a while if it's busy, i mean, he is only one man, but it's worth it. And there's something about being hidden in the alley that takes you away from all the corporate bullshit swirling around outside.
author: mike s.

description: Decent after-work crowd, but I never know what/when the Happy Hour is for this place.  Do they have one???  Also, I think the crowd here is a bit older, but friendly nonetheless.
author: Lisa R.

description:
This place is like CHEERS in the Financial District.

By the third visit, the bartender remembered my name and my drink, kept the drinks coming, started sassing me for fun. Lots of local charm and people obviously knew each other there, which is cool. Superb Phillycheese steak, and yeah, the Cajun Fries are awesome. I am hooked! Fun and sassy asiangurl bartenders and cool waitstaff an additional plus. I like the place cause it is off the beaten track on a sidestreet. Definitely worth checking out for lively crowd, cool bartenders and good drink prices.
author: Ken Y.

description:
As an after work spot this place is probably worth three stars.  As a place to go for lunch in the financial district it is 5 stars.  The burger is pretty good, the fish and chips only ok, but the Cheese Steaks and BBQ Pork Sandwiches are the best I've found in this city.

The staff is great too.  The bartender is ridiculously nice, and always remembers my order.  If I call it in, she'll have it waiting for me when I arrive.  I like that a lot.  Great place.
author: Matthew H.

description: hamburger is as good as it gets. fries are bangin'.  drinks are strong. love, love, love louie's for lunch/work.  perfect dive bar atmosphere and cindy is a ROCKSTAR!
author: Jenny B.

description:
I went there for lunch with the work crew and we arrived after 1. We were able to be seated right away, but several of my co-workers joked how it had that Vegas-y feel to it. No, not the dancers and the shows and the endless whirling lights and bells of the slot  machines. It was more of the fact that Louie's was dimly lit with no windows and you could easily lose track of time in there.

Our waitress was nice enough to my boss, but then again that's because he's a regular and he likes to drink. When it came for her to take our orders, she was very militant and refused to process an order for quesdillas because she was "only taking drink orders at this time." Eventually, my co-worker made her understand that we just wanted one order because we were very hungry and that we would be ordering food right away anyway.

*sigh*

I had the beef burger and asked for it to be cooked medium-rare. It came to be medium-well. And when I asked our waitress for a side of mayo, she huffed loudly enough for me to hear, then even louder asked if anyone else needed any other sides.

*sigh*

The Cajun fries were good though.
author: Judy F.

description: The burger and cheesesteak are awesome, not a big fan of the fries.  A good lunch spot.
author: Sean A.

description:
These guys are rad. They always end up draining my hard earned funds but we have a ton of fun there. The servers are great and know us by name. Is there really anything better? Best for Friday after work kick starts to the evening. Watch the Jager/Tequila shots though... easy way to drop a couple bills before you have even changed out of your work flip flops. 

Go early and stake out some tables other wise you have to stand around waiting and harrassing people until they leave. :)
author: Robert A.

description:
This may be the start of a beautiful friendship ... 

This bar has everything I need: great staff (waitress was on it with those drink refills), decent bar food, reasonably priced drinks (can't beat 2 dollar beer when you get lunch). Although a bit small, it's got a classic feel to it (brick walls, dimly lit). It's located in some alley. I accidentally found it while looking for a new place to eat some lunch, and I'm glad I did. I will definitely be going back.
author: Anthony G.

description: great little unpretentious spot with nice rotating selection of beer.  loud and crowded after work but if you hit it at the right time it's good.  kitchen open late.
author: Tomas M.

description:
A dive bar that can't do nachos? Nacho chips and velveta cheese do not equal nachos. (Seriously, the waitress told us that salsa would be extra.)

My friend had the pulled pork and said it was great, though.

My ceasar salad was not good, either. The food really kills their cool dive bar atmosphere.
author: leslie l.

description: standard chill bar. good spot to grab a beer after work. cindy is wonderful !!
author: Sunni B.

description: Wouldn't order the food here and there's so-so service. The decor definitely needs work too.  Somehow I always end up here anyway -- I think my boss likes this place, and it's right behind our office building.  The highlights?  Good HH prices on drinks and no pretension at all.
author: Sid D.

description:
it's small, yes. it's loud, yes. what do you expect? it's in an alley. and yet, fidi ppl still find it. 

this is my work team's it place for happy hour when we go. 

they have a full bar and by full, i mean they carry my favorite and not so often seen at the bar drink - hpnotiq. actually, i'm known as the hpnotiq girl there. i think i'm the only one who drinks their bottle. don't know if they'd restock if they ran out and i stopped going. wonder if they would restock if they ran out/ i drank all of it and i still went... hmmm.... note to self: remember to test this.

they have great bar food. and by bar food, i mean fried food. :) any time they can batter something, they do it well. and if they can put cheese on it? they put a lot. needless to say, my kind of place. :) 

the waitresses are also very attentive and will quickly come to you with the notification of a hand wave. 

can't wait till the firm reserves this place next friday so i can nosh on free good food and buy some drinks. Woot!
author: Melissa C.

description: Louie's is easy to miss, being tucked away on Stevenson. I had lunch here for the first time in the 4 years I've worked in the neighborhood. I was pretty pleased with their pulled chicken sandwich, which came with a choice of cajun, garlic or regular fries. I got the cajun which was spicy and crispy, just how I like my fries. Free refills on soda was a plus. The crowd was a pretty mellow work crowd and the service was nice. Seemed like a nice spot to grab drinks after work with coworkers.
author: Connie C.

description: TVs, check!  Beer selection, check!  Decent service, check!  Definitely off the beaten path, but my friends and I stumbled on our new waste our time watching sports and adding major calories.  The co-owner\bartender is cool people.  The calamari and fries are really that good, but avoid at all cost the Nacho carnitas dish.  Be careful to watch your consumption of the calamari and fries because it had shreds of garlic and I was still tasting it the night after.  Bad breath and indigestion.
author: Jason A.

description: Total blue collar bar. No, seriously, we walked in here for lunch one day and there was a table of 5 guys all wearing blue collared shirts. It was sort of eery how fitting it was. Louie has some tasty beers on tap and the exposed brick is pretty cool, but it seemed unfinished and sad in here to me. Maybe Louie gets his groove on around happy hour instead.
author: Michael E.

description: Very much the spot on Sushi nights...Friday??  Cindy and Tina are hilarious with their good-cop / bad-cop routine (u can guess who is who)  Brian holds it down in the kitchen--nice guy..Usually pay a cover on those nights--like ten bucks and all you can eat =)  Yippee!  Like the open space feel tho a bit narrow..never have to wait 4 the bano.  Usually attracts a laid-back, friendly, mixed crowd--fun to watch b-ball there after work.
author: omar b.

description: 5 star rating on the wings alone!!!  Wow I've been searching high and low for wings just like this.  Perfectly made, extra crispy with spicy vinegar sauce.  Outstanding.  For this alone I will return over and over again.
author: La C.

description: Another good place to try after work, though it can get a lil crowded. This is more of a young professional type bar...not as seedy looking as Sutter Station. Definitely a place you can bring your boss.
author: Dustin L.

description: It's got everything you need: beer, food, and sports. Good for lunch and after work drinks. Bad: trying to find the place if you're already drunk. Don't bother, you'll just hurt yourself and possibly others.
author: Ali L.

description: This is a perfect after work spot.  The staff, drinks, food and clientele is excellent.  Stop by if you get the chance.
author: Jonathon J.

description: I went on a Friday night for one of their open bar + sushi events.  Not sure if this is the usual Fri night scene (where there's generally no cover, I think), but the crowd, mostly mid-20s, had an air of success to it and some sort of hip anti-conformity feel.  I don't think I've ever seen so many different kinds of collared shirts with unique patterns or a guy wearing a full pin-stripe brown suit. Bartenders and sushi chefs were incredibly friendly and attentive, even when it got really crowded and busy -- I never had to wait more than 2 min to get the bartender's attention and my drink.  There are more than 2 TVs here for people who want to keep tabs on games.  Awesome selection of beers on tap -- including Sierra, Fat Tire, and Sapporo.  There's an additional bathroom downstairs that no one seemed to know about, so I never had to wait.
author: Erica Y.

description: Where the @#$!$ is this place?!?!?!?  Ahhhh . . . but once inside, you feel instantly cool.  Young hip crowd, trying not to look too young or hip.  Solid hang out after work.  When it is crowded, it gets a little echoey (sp?) but otherwise solid
author: Bruce R.

description: This has to be the most underrated after work drink spot in the FiDi.  Great service and healthy serving of alcohol.  The owner is friendly and accomodating.  It can get busy espcially during the sushi nights, where $15 gets you open bar the whole night.  Check it out when you are around the neighborhood.  No 1 star haters allowed.
author: Tina C.

description: Another great hang out in the financial district. Serving great bar food, great drink specials, and sports on the tellie. It can get pretty crowded on Friday nights after work, but if you send out a scout around 5, you can get a table for your whole gang.
author: Katie U.

description: I really like the place not only does it have great drink and a nice staff but they make the best fries. If you are in the downtown area please check Louie's Bar out after work.
author: Dee Z.

description: I go here often with co-workers after work to grab a few drinks. When not crowded, its a great place to go with friends, drink, and be merry. When crowded, its small, cramped, and loud. They don't have very good drink specials and their happy hour seems to be strategically placed right before I get off work. Not much more than your garden variety bar. Not worth the trip unless your close by. If Louie's wasn't more than a few yards away you definitely wouldn't find me here. I go simply for the convenience of it.
author: Brad M.

description: I thought this place was bigger for some reason. You walk in, and it's pretty small. There are a few tables, after work you'll be lucky if you grab one. The beer is cold and the drinks are of decent strength. Typical after work type of crowd. There's a kitchen in the back, but have never eaten here. There's a bartender with one of the best tats I've seen. And I've only seen part of it...but still worth an extra star.
author: The Sock S.

description: Home of Albert's "Rock n Sushi" parties. Good service. Easy access to the bar. There's no attitude here.
author: Keith K.

description: This place sucks! I have never seen so many ugly people mingling in one spot. Maybe my girlfriends and I came in on ugly-appreciation day or something but holy hell - I was floored. The best looking guy in the joint had a hook nose and blue hair. Will only come back if I am forced to against my will, bound and gagged. Who even cares about the drinks or food - I couldn't get past the crowd.
author: Sadia J.

description: This is a perfect place for a lunch time pint and some fried food. If  you are having that craving for bar & grill style, you can't go wrong with this place. It is a convenient location as well to the financial district for a timely lunch. The bartender, chef and wait staff are all awesome as well!
author: Jessica E.

description:
Disclaimer:  I am friends with one of the owners

Louie's is a place to come after work.  It's a hidden gem hidden in the alley next to Yank Sing in the SOMA area, Louie's is a great spot for having some after work drinks with friends.

The bar itself is long and narrow, and at times seating can be limited. However, the food is quite good with generous portions. The drinks are great. The staff is very friendly and attentive.
author: Andrew I.

description: Bottomline - Best burger in the city at lunchtime.  My understanding is that the cat that 'mans' the grill isn't there for dinner time but lunch is all good.
author: kevin h.

description: This is definitely the place where blue collar and white collar come together to drink. I sat down to a cup of Japanese beer on TAP for the first time ever in the USA [for me that is]. The place is just big enough for someone my size to still be comfortable and just small enough not to be obnoxious, close to the heart of the financial district so not too far to walk drunk to BART, and off the beaten path enough to skip away from the groupies and yuppies. Too hard to describe however just drunk enough not to remember. Me likes.
author: JP X.

description: Reasonable lunch spot.  I had the turkey on sourdough with Swiss and the largest portion of coleslaw that I have ever experienced.  The sandwich was fresh but the service was not.  The woman who served us was not the happiest camper that I have ever met.  I would go back if I got lost in the city and couldn't find anything else.  The other individuals that I was with had the quesadilla and the Philly and they seemed to be having the same experience that I was, fair-to-moderate.
author: Chase B.

description: I've been coming here with some friends in recent times. I like this place. The beers are cheap, and the place is of a decent size (and it's always packed at the times where fidi ppl get off work). I had their burgers and fries once, and it was very delicious. I picked the cajun fries and chicken burger. The cajun fries were awesome! The bartenders are pretty as well.
author: Sam W.

description: Good place for post work drinks. Yummy fries. AND they offer pitchers!
author: Mary P.

description: Convenient location. Great prices. Very nice atmosphere. It's nice and clean but not super fancy. It's a pretty small space and tables can be hard to come by. Food is pretty average. I'll just say that the food is acceptable. It's an ok place to grab drinks after work and that's about it.
author: Su K.

description: A caesar salad is about $6.50. Add chicken for $2, but you don't get that much chicken. So I figured doubling the chicken would cost me another $2. Nope. The cook was adamant that they charge $4 for the next portion of chicken. I don't know what crawled up him. I work in the building right above, but now I hardly go there at all. I hate nonsense like that. Go ahead, flame me, but if I am going to be a regular, I don't expect to be nickled and dimed so deliberately.
author: Brian H.

description: BEST nachoes and fries for happy hour after a long day's work.  The bartender is GREAT, and the atmosphere is awesome!!!
author: Alice L.

description:
I stumbled across Louies while I was stupid drunk in the middle of the afternoon.  I wanted a refresher -- keep the flow going..so decided to stop by.  I was greeted by a super hot bar wench behind the bar with tattoos riminiscent of my days spent in Japan hanging out with Harjuku girls and the occassional Yakuza henchmen.  

The bar is old school -- kinda speakeasy-ish.  All hush hush.. The kind of place people go to meet their not-significant other (if you know what i mean  ;)   ).  The drinks were reasonably priced and the food was pretty good -- got the burger and the garlic fries.  

This place is cool to go to in the afternoons when you want to meet your friends to go have drinks.
author: Chris L.

description: I don't know BUT I found this bar to be kind of boring...in fact we all left after a round of drinks!!  Someone in our group pointed that the bar smelled either like a Veterinarian's office or a pound...but it definitely did smell like Pine-Sol in there....
author: Karen B.

description: I spent many a lunch break at Louie's when I was working in San Francisco. They've got good food, good beer, and a fantastic staff. Be sure to say hi to Cindy (one of the bartenders), she's fantastic. And tell her that Josh sent you!
author: Josh O.

description: The people that work here are pretty nice, but the mixed drinks don't seem to have enough alcohol and the bar food is average.  The nachos is particularly bad.  It's an ok enough bar, but lacks character and personality.
author: Naomi N.

description: I think the fact that this place gets rated so highly speaks to how bad after-hours places are in SF.  I found this place completely generic, as if someone purchased a yellow box at Safeway entitled "Bar," opened it up, and voila, there is Louie's.
author: Paul K.

description:
i have been there many times and have always enjoed myself. the staff is attractive and friendly and the food is surprisingly really tasty. it' average bar-fare but they do an excellent with it. good cocktails. minus a star just cuz it's not exactly the type of demographic i usually look for when i booz out on the town.

edit: i have actually had some amazing fukkin' times at this bar to make it   a fiver.
author: shanti s.

description: I 've been going to  Louie's bar and grill for years. They have a great beer selection on tap and great food. I always bring my clients here for lunch,   their burgers come with  generous portions of  fries.  Defininitely a great place to go for drinks  during or after work.
author: drew w.

description: Just had lunch here, really good.  Its Friday (being catholic) I had the fish and chips.  The fish was a little bit crispy and the fries in one word, AWSOME.  Also note that the soda was one of the sweetest I have had and I love soda.
author: andres c.

description:
If decor and ambiance are high priority, don't go here.  However, if you are looking for the best french fries downtown (even better than Cafe Bastille!), you gotta check out Louie's.

A must have:  the cheesesteak sandwich.  The meat is always super-tender, the roll appropriately soft with a slight bit of crunch, absolutely perfect addition of banana peppers.  This is by no means a light lunch; perfect hideaway to have a beer at lunch and be low-key.
author: Brenda F.

description:
Best bar in the financial district, hands down!

The staff is super friendly, very accommodating and most likely will remember your drink of choice if you go there on a regular basis.

The burgers are the best, FRIES are solid, and wings are even better. You can pretty much order anything on this menu and be satisfied. 

Also have a good selection of beers on tap and have great happy hour specials.
author: andrew l.

description:
average bar, decent drinks, mediocre food, and great cans.

In all seriousness, this is a fun place to hang out, donkeyboner!
author: Beer L.

description: I would recommend other options.  I love being treated by crap by bartenders who speak English at a 2nd grade level.  I also love watered down drinks... I'm being sarcastic.
author: Amar M.

description: stay away so that i can sit here and enjoy my drinks in peace.
author: Joel D.

description: The burgers are pretty good but the fries are the best part. Choose from normal, cajun, or garlic fries. They also have great happy hour specials and different themed events every now and then that are always a lot of fun. It's a pretty small place though so it can get rather crowded at times. But, it's definitely a great place to grab some lunch or hang out with friends for happy hour.
author: Jim K.

description: Fucking Great Bar. Food is awesome. Always strong drinks and great beer selection. Friday are a busy Lunch try earlier in the week. Staff are a fun bunch and quick. Great place to have a pint or a party.
author: Brian F.
